[Parallels in the Duel on the Invisible Hand and the Duel on the Death Star II](/f/p/4400000000003951142)

Something I noticed while reading the Revenge of the Sith novelization is how the Duel on the Invisible Hand between Anakin and Count Dooku parallels Luke‚Äôs fight with Darth Vader aboard the Death Star II in Return of the Jedi.

![Fandom Image](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/6b438878-74b2-4059-bd8f-e7e27cdcc44f/scale-to-width/755)

The set-up is largely the same: each encounter is meant to be a ‚Äútrap‚Äù for Anakin and Luke, with Darth Sidious seeking to drive each to the dark side. Sidious presides over each fight from a throne-like chair (the ROTS novelization makes clear that while Sidious is play-acting the captured Chancellor, he‚Äôs still in control of the situation) as his current and prospective pupils duke it out.

Anakin and Luke both emerge victorious, but only after tapping tapping into their hate and anger of their Sith opponent. Sidious then encourages both Skywalkers to execute his fallen apprentices (and take their place, even if Sidious is not ready to say the quiet part out loud to Anakin).

![Fandom Image](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/ff97fe01-2cd7-4613-8343-f26317a1dc2d/scale-to-width/755)

I love these similar ‚ÄúJedi Traps‚Äù that Sidious sets-up because it conveys so much about Sidious as well as the Skywalkers.

For Sidious, it shows how disposable his apprentices are to him and how all the promises and grand gestures he made to Dooku and Vader‚Äîthat they‚Äôd rule at his side forever‚Äîwere completely meaningless. It emphasizes the twisted view of the Master-Apprentice dynamic among the Sith.

For the Skywalkers, the similarities between the duels and their contrasting outcomes highlights the differences in Anakin‚Äôs and Luke‚Äôs characters: Anakin obeys Sidious and executes Dooku in cold blood, whereas Luke throws away his weapon on rebukes Sidious. Ironically, Anakin‚Äôs ‚Äúshow of strength‚Äù in killing Dooku leaves him disoriented and disgusted, whereas Luke‚Äôs show of compassion leaves him a stronger Jedi than ever. The parallels drive home how Luke surpassed and redeemed his father‚Äôs actions years later.

I also think it‚Äôs really cool from a story structure standpoint: Anakin‚Äôs duel with Dooku takes place very early on in Revenge of the Sith, whereas Luke‚Äôs duel with Vader takes place in the third act of the third movie of a trilogy. What is for Luke a culmination of his Hero‚Äôs Journey up to that point is for Anakin a catalyzing event for his tragic fall.

George Lucas did a lot between the prequels and originals to intentionally draw parallels between Anakin and Luke (e.g., Anakin destroying the Trade Federation command ship in The Phantom Menace and Luke destroying the Death Star in A New Hope, Anakin and Luke being defeated and dismembered by Dooku and Vader in Attack of the Clones and The Empire Strikes Back respectively).

But this particular symmetry stands out to me because it‚Äôs one of the first discordant moments in that parallel structure. I believe it‚Äôs the first, or at least first major, time the films invite a comparison between Anakin and Luke only to show you how different their characters and their destinies are.

I guess it‚Äôs nothing groundbreaking, and I‚Äôm certainly not the first to pick up on this particular parallel, but I wanted to bring attention to stuff like this, as it adds to the feeling of the original saga being a single, cohesive epic where one difference in a character‚Äôs decision makes all the difference for the story.

![Fandom Image](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/93af0289-f476-4e6d-ab29-362433f6f7c4/scale-to-width/755)

[Cue by Cue: The Music of John Williams - #2.37 ESB (1980) - 10m3 Chewie Chokes Lando](/f/p/4400000000003951196)

Hello and welcome to this week's installment of Cue by Cue.

Today we're going to be listening to one of my favorite cues of this score, ***10m3*** **Chewie Chokes Lando**.

This cue is 114 bars long and was orchestrated by Herb Spencer.

Here are the tops of the sketch and the orchestrated score:

![Fandom Image](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/e93f9cbd-671a-4b45-a61d-dcc29336d386/scale-to-width/755)

![Fandom Image](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/c698fc2c-9b57-4a62-af49-bad6aa94bebe/scale-to-width/755)

Now let's listen to the cue together:

<https://youtu.be/JsF0v93LkqA>

At 0:00 the cue begins with some string notes playing Bespin Dirge 1. Notably, when this theme appeared in ***9m6-10m1*** **Carbon Freeze** it was very militaristic for Vader giving orders, and its variant at the start of 10m2 Luke Pursues the Captives was very sad and funeral-like. Here it's back to being militaristic, but more upbeat as Lando almost immediately gives an order to his guards to take the stormtroopers prisoner and release the rebels.

Some plucky woodwinds as he collects all the guns, before the Dirge returns at 0:17 as the troops start marching again. This continues as Lando removes Chewie's handcuffs, building into some tense music as the choking begins at 0:30.The tension is mostly held with atonal strings and brass, with some accentuation from staccato and piano, as well as some pizzicato strings.

This continues until 1:01 when the strings return and sound like they're about to start playing Bespin Dirge 1 again, but bounce around it until the brass kicks in at 1:06 with Bespin Dirge 2 for the shot of Boba Fett.

At 1:16 the strings return again - it seems they come back slightly before the shot change, perhaps they missed their sync mark. It's definitely not a sync issue on my part nor a video edit issue, there's no way to get this mark to sync without messing up every other mark before or after it. The strings are quickly joined by the love theme at 1:20, which plays in a heroic mode as the rebels sprint to try and rescue Han from the Slave I.

The love theme changes modes to be sadder and almost despairful at 1:50 as Leia sadly watches the Slave I depart.

The love theme finally ends with a crash at 2:06, immediately cutting back into the Vader/Luke lightsaber fight. Some brief atonal percussion music before some piano accentuates Luke's lightsaber falling at 2:15.

This is immediately followed by an imposing brass rendition of the Imperial March as Luke rolls down the stairs and Vader jumps after him. I love how the trumpet descends in each accompanying note here, it really accentuates the feeling of total dominance, the Dark Side is winning...

Woodwinds take up the next verse at 2:25, before some ascending brass from 2:31 leading to Luke's fall into the freezing chamber at 2:36.

Three transitional horn notes at 2:41 are followed by a heroic rendition of the Force theme starting at 2:47 as Luke escapes the chamber. The Force theme climaxes as Vader is hit with the steam at 2:57, and immediately leads into an even more heroic rendition of Yoda's theme as Luke reclaims his lightsaber and fights back. This continues through the rest of the battle culminating in a super bombastic brass bit for Luke's flip at 3:17. One last Yoda's theme bit at 3:22, and then some lighthearted Luke theme as Luke walks off at 3:29. Thus, the cue ends...

Only one minor visual edit appears to have been made where they inserted a 1.5s closeup shot of Luke at 2:51, this causes the end of the cue to be out of sync with the final cut. This didn't actually require any music edits in the final film however, as this entire section of the cue was dropped.

In the final theatrical cut:

0:00-0:59 =¬†***10m3*** **Chewie Chokes Lando** 0:00-0:59

0:59-1:09 =¬†***10m3*** **Chewie Chokes Lando** 1:00-1:10

1:09-1:17 =¬†***10m3*** **Chewie Chokes Lando** 1:06-1:15

1:17-1:32 =¬†***10m3*** **Chewie Chokes Lando** 1:18-1:33

1:32-1:46 =¬†***10m3*** **Chewie Chokes Lando** 1:50-2:04

1:46-1:48 =¬†***10m3*** **Chewie Chokes Lando** 2:06-2:08

1:48-end = silence

George Lucas must've decided he really did not like the music edits made to the stem here for the theatrical cut because for the Special Edition release he had it totally scrapped and redone for this cue:

0:00-2:08 = ***10m3*** **Chewie Chokes Lando** 0:00-2:08

2:08-end = silence

In my opinion this is one of the most underrated Special Edition changes. The original analog edits for this cue really sound terrible, and I don't like at all how the cue climaxes and fades out before the Slave I even escapes in the theatrical cut. I think the intended timing featured in the Special Edition works much much better. I will say though I think the decision to dial out all of the music for the Luke/Vader fight was definitely the right one. As brilliant as the music is, and it is some of the best music in the entire score, it really does not fit the mood of the scene at all. Having heroic Force theme and Yoda's theme play as Luke is struggling to survive and run away from Vader really doesn't fit, as cool as it sounds.

Since I don't have a recording log I'm unsure what day this cue was recorded, but based on the take numbers written in the sketch it was likely recorded in early January. I'm also unsure how many takes were recorded, but according to the sketch the performance edit uses takes 168 and 169.

This cue has been officially released on four different albums:

1) In 1980 on RSO Records' OST album

2) In 1993 on Arista Records' 4-CD Anthology box set

3) In 1997 on RCA Victor's 2-CD Special Edition set

4) In 2018 on Walt Disney Records' Remastered album (remastered OST rebuilt from scratch from the session masters)

More specifically, ***10m3*** **Chewie Chokes Lando**can be heard:

From 0:00-3:17 of track 6 "Departure of Boba Fett" on the 1980/2018 albums

From 7:33-end of disc 4 track 17 "Carbon Freeze/Luke Pursues the Captives/Departure of Boba Fett" on the 1993 album

From 8:12-end of disc 2 track 6 "Carbon Freeze/Darth Vader's Trap/Departure of Boba Fett" on the 1997 album.

Only the 1993 and 1997 releases have the clean ending, and none of the releases have the clean opening. The 1993 and 1997 releases have the film mix, every other release is remixed. The 1993 release also accidentally flips the left and right channels.

The 1980/2018 releases are both cutdown, snipping out 0:00-0:16, 1:01-1:17 and 3:27-end:

![Fandom Image](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/797b433d-7b2e-4865-acbe-af66c88da0fb/scale-to-width/755)

Additionally, most releases of this cue play at the wrong pitch/speed, although this can easily be corrected in an audio editor:

* 1980 set has to be sped up by 0.300 before the microedit and by 0.060 after the microedit. Why these speeds are different I'm not entirely sure.
* 1993 set has to be slowed down by -0.190 to match film
* 1997 set¬†has to be sped up by 0.570 to match film
* 2018 set has to be slowed down by -0.650 before the microedit and by -0.425 after the microedit. Why these speeds are different I'm not entirely sure.

For my edit I used a speed corrected copy of the 1993 set, with a clean opening taken from the Radio Drama (ESB episode 9, 13:04). Thankfully it contained this cue with a clean opening without any SFX or dialogue, no AI required.

That's all I have today, thanks for reading!¬†Feel free to leave any comments or questions.

Next week we'll be listening to ***11m1*** **Through the Window**. See you then!

(Edited by Enderdrag64)

# Welcome to the community!

Wookieepedia is a wiki-based online encyclopedia that contains detailed information about the Star Wars universe, including movies, books, video games, characters, locations, technology, weapons, vehicles, and everything in between.
Founded in 2005, Wookieepedia has over 200,000 articles, covering everything from the AA-12X VerboBrain, a brain used in AD-series weapons maintenance droids, to Zzzzyxxx, a character found at the end of the original edition of the Star Tours ride at Tokyo Disneyland.

Wookieepedia Celebrates 20 Years!

 [![Wook-20th-logo](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](/wiki/Wookieepedia "Wookieepedia") [![Wook-20th-logo](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/9/95/Wook-20th-logo.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/270?cb=20250305061023)](/wiki/Wookieepedia "Wookieepedia") 



 

**March 4, starwars.fandom.com**‚ÄîTwenty years ago, *Star Wars* fans were eagerly awaiting the [*REVENGE OF THE SITH*](/wiki/Star_Wars:_Episode_III_Revenge_of_the_Sith "Star Wars: Episode III Revenge of the Sith"), exploring the depths of [Nar Shaddaa](/wiki/Nar_Shaddaa/Legends "Nar Shaddaa/Legends") in the [*KNIGHTS OF THE OLD REPUBLIC II*](/wiki/Star_Wars:_Knights_of_the_Old_Republic_II:_The_Sith_Lords "Star Wars: Knights of the Old Republic II: The Sith Lords"), and beginning to build [WOOKIEEPEDIA](/wiki/Wookieepedia "Wookieepedia")‚Äîthe *Star Wars* wiki. As an ever-growing community of volunteers, the Wookieepedia project now celebrates its 20th year.

Our encyclopedia officially reached **200,000 articles** in February, 2025. This was only possible with the work of hundreds upon hundreds of fans over the past twenty years. Most Wookieepedians started off editing with little to no writing or coding experience, but our efforts have brought us closer to the goal of creating the most accurate, comprehensive, and well-presented resource about all things *Star Wars*.

Since Wookieepedia's [tenth anniversary](/wiki/Wookieepedia:Tenth_Anniversary_Timeline "Wookieepedia:Tenth Anniversary Timeline") in 2015, we have expanded the **breadth, depth, and quality** of our documentation of both the [*Star Wars* Legends](/wiki/Star_Wars_Legends "Star Wars Legends") and the new [canon](/wiki/Canon "Canon") continuities, as well as coverage of *Star Wars* media and production behind the scenes. Wookieepedia has also been building **a more friendly and welcoming community**. Informed by our contributors' experiences, we have launched ongoing efforts in revamping our [policies](/wiki/Wookieepedia:About "Wookieepedia:About") to be clearer and more fair, improving accessibility, and developing new [editing tutorials](/wiki/Wookieepedia:Editing_tutorial:_Padawan "Wookieepedia:Editing tutorial: Padawan").

Since 2015, editor recruitment has advanced on Wookieepedia, with the great majority of the current [administrators](/wiki/Wookieepedia:Administrators "Wookieepedia:Administrators") and [review board members](/wiki/Wookieepedia:EduCorps "Wookieepedia:EduCorps") having joined those groups in recent years. The past ten years has also seen the progress of the [Discussions forum](/wiki/Wookieepedia:Discussions "Wookieepedia:Discussions") and the launch of twenty-two new collaborative [WookieeProjects](/wiki/Wookieepedia:WookieeProjects "Wookieepedia:WookieeProjects"). These include the [Project Stardust](/wiki/Wookieepedia:Project_Stardust "Wookieepedia:Project Stardust") initiative focusing on essential topics and [Project Pride's](/wiki/Wookieepedia:WookieeProject_Pride "Wookieepedia:WookieeProject Pride") efforts to improve the wiki's coverage of LGBTQIA+ topics. Most external links on Wookieepedia now have [backup archival links](/wiki/Forum:SH:Pages_with_missing_archive_links "Forum:SH:Pages with missing archive links") to keep a better record of the ever-changing Internet, and [bot](/wiki/Wookieepedia:Bots "Wookieepedia:Bots") systems have automated many monotonous site maintenance tasks such as page archivals for the [status article](/wiki/Wookieepedia:Featured_article_nominations "Wookieepedia:Featured article nominations") peer review system.

Our work continues unabated. Thousands more pages [need to be created](/wiki/Special:WantedPages "Special:WantedPages"), [lack citations](/wiki/Category:Articles_needing_citation "Category:Articles needing citation"), [await expansion](/wiki/Category:Articles_to_be_expanded "Category:Articles to be expanded"), and could use [more images](/wiki/Category:Articles_needing_illustration "Category:Articles needing illustration"). All the while, the franchise continues to grow and [require updates](/wiki/Category:Articles_in_need_of_updating "Category:Articles in need of updating"). As we enter our third decade, we would love for more readers to [**join our ranks!**](/wiki/Wookieepedia:Welcome,_newcomers "Wookieepedia:Welcome, newcomers") May the Force be with us in the next twenty years‚Ä¶ ‚ú®

 Article Showcase

  

[![Nishr Taskforce](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](/wiki/Nishr_Taskforce "Nishr Taskforce")

The **[Nishr Taskforce](/wiki/Nishr_Taskforce "Nishr Taskforce")** was a unit of [Alliance Special Forces](/wiki/Alliance_Special_Forces/Legends "Alliance Special Forces/Legends") assembled in [0 ABY](/wiki/0_ABY/Legends "0 ABY/Legends") for the [Nishr Campaign](/wiki/Nishr_Campaign "Nishr Campaign"), a series of battles fought on the [planet](/wiki/Planet/Legends "Planet/Legends") [Nishr](/wiki/Nishr "Nishr") during the [Galactic Civil War](/wiki/Galactic_Civil_War/Legends "Galactic Civil War/Legends"). Consisting of three [platoons](/wiki/Platoon/Legends "Platoon/Legends") of [Wilderness Fighters](/wiki/Wilderness_Fighters "Wilderness Fighters") and a single platoon of [Pathfinders](/wiki/Pathfinders/Legends "Pathfinders/Legends"), the unit was commanded by [Major](/wiki/Major/Legends "Major/Legends") [Fisk Csino](/wiki/Fisk_Csino "Fisk Csino") and styled as a light-armor company, employing numerous ground vehicles to keep the company on the move. Created in response to the forceful [suppression](/wiki/Nishr_Suppression "Nishr Suppression") of the native [Nish](/wiki/Nish "Nish") by [Imperial](/wiki/Galactic_Empire/Legends "Galactic Empire/Legends") forces on Nishr, the Nishr Taskforce was assigned to harass the local [garrison](/wiki/Garrison/Legends "Garrison/Legends") and encourage the local population to stage a guerrilla-style rebellion. Operating out of several hidden bases, the company‚Äîin concert with local forces from the [Nishr Resistance](/wiki/Nishr_Resistance "Nishr Resistance")‚Äîeliminated the [Imperial garrison's](/wiki/Nishr_Imperial_garrison "Nishr Imperial garrison") mobile elements. This forced the Imperials to heavily defend their command base and effectively concede control of the countryside and plains to the Rebel force. As the campaign carried on, Major Csino's request for a unit of [Infiltrator commandos](/wiki/Infiltrators/Legends "Infiltrators/Legends") to directly assault the garrison's command center was denied. Instead, the Alliance initiated [Operation Shadowplay](/wiki/Operation_Shadowplay "Operation Shadowplay"), designed to fool the Imperial planetary commander, [Governor](/wiki/Governor/Legends "Governor/Legends")-[General](/wiki/General/Legends "General/Legends") [Vin Kollis](/wiki/Vin_Kollis "Vin Kollis"), into thinking that the unit had been reinforced with Infiltrators, when in reality they had not been. **([Read more‚Ä¶](/wiki/Nishr_Taskforce "Nishr Taskforce"))**

* The [**Featured article**](/wiki/Wookieepedia:Featured_article_nominations "Wookieepedia:Featured article nominations"), [**Good article**](/wiki/Wookieepedia:Good_article_nominations "Wookieepedia:Good article nominations"), and [**Comprehensive article**](/wiki/Wookieepedia:Comprehensive_article_nominations "Wookieepedia:Comprehensive article nominations") nomination processes help bring articles up to the highest possible standards. Join the effort by helping review nominations.
* [**WookieeProject Creators**](/wiki/Wookieepedia:WookieeProject_Creators "Wookieepedia:WookieeProject Creators") is adding the full credits to all media articles. You can assist the team by visiting any article on a piece of media and expanding the credits list.

:   "*Blind allegiance makes you a pawn. A real leader protects his squad.*"
:   ‚ÄïHunter, to Crosshair[[6]](#cite_note-Kamino_Lost-6)

**Hunter**, formerly designated **CT-9901**, was a veteran [Clone Sergeant](/wiki/Clone_Sergeant "Clone Sergeant") who served as the [commanding officer](/wiki/Commanding_officer "Commanding officer") of [Clone Force 99](/wiki/Clone_Force_99 "Clone Force 99") in the [Grand Army of the Republic](/wiki/Grand_Army_of_the_Republic "Grand Army of the Republic") during the [Clone Wars](/wiki/Clone_Wars "Clone Wars"), fought between the [Galactic Republic](/wiki/Galactic_Republic "Galactic Republic") and the [Confederacy of Independent Systems](/wiki/Confederacy_of_Independent_Systems "Confederacy of Independent Systems"). [He](/wiki/Gender "Gender") was genetically altered to have heightened senses and commanded his comrades who had their own unique [mutations](/wiki/Genetically_defective_clone "Genetically defective clone"), in what they called the "Bad Batch." Other members of the [squad](/wiki/Squad "Squad") included [Wrecker](/wiki/Wrecker "Wrecker"), [Tech](/wiki/Tech "Tech"), and [Crosshair](/wiki/Crosshair "Crosshair"), and later, [Echo](/wiki/Echo "Echo").

In [19 BBY](/wiki/19_BBY "19 BBY"), Hunter and Clone Force 99 were recalled from an [insurrection on Yalbec Prime](/wiki/Insurrection_on_Yalbec_Prime "Insurrection on Yalbec Prime") to the planet [Anaxes](/wiki/Anaxes "Anaxes") by [Clone Marshal Commander](/wiki/Clone_Marshal_Commander "Clone Marshal Commander") [Cody](/wiki/Cody "Cody"), who along with [Clone Captain](/wiki/Clone_Captain "Clone Captain") [Rex](/wiki/Rex "Rex") was planning an infiltration of a Separatist [Cyber Center](/wiki/Cyber_Center "Cyber Center") to discover why Republic forces were strategically outmaneuvered in the [battle](/wiki/Battle_of_Anaxes "Battle of Anaxes") there. In the mission, Hunter demonstrated his [squad](/wiki/Squad "Squad")'s aggressive methods, leading full frontal charges and earning the respect of Captain Rex. After successfully infiltrating the Cyber Center, Rex and Tech discovered that their strategies had been compromised by Echo, a long-lost [Advanced Recon Commando](/wiki/Advanced_Recon_Commando "Advanced Recon Commando"). Clone Force 99 joined Rex and [Anakin Skywalker](/wiki/Anakin_Skywalker "Anakin Skywalker")'s [mission](/wiki/Mission_to_Skako_Minor_(Clone_Wars) "Mission to Skako Minor (Clone Wars)") to find Echo on [Skako Minor](/wiki/Skako_Minor "Skako Minor"). After rescuing Echo and facilitating the demise of Separatist [Admiral](/wiki/Admiral "Admiral") [Trench](/wiki/Trench "Trench"), Hunter extended an offer to the [cybernetically](/wiki/Cyborg "Cyborg")-enhanced clone to join his crew, which Echo accepted.

Most of the members' mutations and the ordeal Echo suffered prior to joining caused their [inhibitor chips](/wiki/Behavioral_modification_biochip "Behavioral modification biochip") to fail, meaning Clone Force 99 was able to disobey [Order 66](/wiki/Order_66 "Order 66"). With the [Proclamation of the New Order](/wiki/Proclamation_of_the_New_Order "Proclamation of the New Order") and the rise of the [Galactic Empire](/wiki/Galactic_Empire "Galactic Empire") from the shell of the Republic, Clone Force 99‚Äîwith the exception of Crosshair, whose chip had functioned properly‚Äîdefected with a child named [Omega](/wiki/Omega "Omega"), and [Admiral](/wiki/Admiral "Admiral") [Wilhuff Tarkin](/wiki/Wilhuff_Tarkin "Wilhuff Tarkin") ordered that they be hunted down. He would go on to lead Clone Force 99 as a mercenary outfit under the employ of [Trandoshan](/wiki/Trandoshan "Trandoshan") broker [Ciddarin Scaleback](/wiki/Ciddarin_Scaleback "Ciddarin Scaleback"). After settling down later in life on [Pabu](/wiki/Pabu_island "Pabu island"), he would serve as a father figure to Omega.

## Biography[]

### The Clone Wars[]

#### The Bad Batch[]

:   "*I've heard mixed things about these guys."  
    "They have a 100% success rate."  
    "It's not that they win, it's how they win that worries me.*"
:   ‚ÄïJesse and Kix discuss the Bad Batch[[2]](#cite_note-The_Bad_Batch-2)

 [![Hunter (second left) was an original member of Clone Force 99, "The Bad Batch"](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/4/48/Clone_Force_99_Bad_Batch.png/revision/latest?cb=20240913132451) [![Hunter (second left) was an original member of Clone Force 99, "The Bad Batch"](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/4/48/Clone_Force_99_Bad_Batch.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20240913132451)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/4/48/Clone_Force_99_Bad_Batch.png/revision/latest?cb=20240913132451) 

Hunter (second left) was an original member of Clone Force 99, "The Bad Batch"

 

One of the millions of [clones](/wiki/Cloning "Cloning") of the [human](/wiki/Human "Human") [male](/wiki/Gender "Gender") [bounty hunter](/wiki/Bounty_hunter "Bounty hunter") [Jango Fett](/wiki/Jango_Fett "Jango Fett") grown on the [planet](/wiki/Planet "Planet") [Kamino](/wiki/Kamino "Kamino"),[[7]](#cite_note-Databank_Clone_Troopers-7) Hunter‚Äîdesignated CT-9901[[8]](#cite_note-Shatterpoint-8)‚Äîwas the leader of the experimental unit [Clone Force 99](/wiki/Clone_Force_99 "Clone Force 99"), also known by its members as "The Bad Batch." The elite clone [squad](/wiki/Squad "Squad") consisted of [clone commandos](/wiki/Clone_commando "Clone commando") with desirable genetic mutations, with Hunter's mutations giving him enhanced senses. He was able to feel electromagnetic frequencies from anywhere on a planet. Hunter served as a [Clone Sergeant](/wiki/Clone_Sergeant "Clone Sergeant"), commanding the sharpshooter [Crosshair](/wiki/Crosshair "Crosshair"), the brute [Wrecker](/wiki/Wrecker "Wrecker"), and the technology genius [Tech](/wiki/Tech "Tech"). The squad flew in an [Omicron-class attack shuttle](/wiki/Omicron-class_attack_shuttle "Omicron-class attack shuttle") called the [*Marauder*](/wiki/Marauder_(Omicron-class) "Marauder (Omicron-class)"). Clone Force 99 was named after the [Maintenance duty clone](/wiki/Maintenance_duty_clone "Maintenance duty clone") [99](/wiki/Clone_99 "Clone 99"), who was [killed](/wiki/Death "Death") in the [Battle of Kamino](/wiki/Battle_of_Kamino "Battle of Kamino").[[2]](#cite_note-The_Bad_Batch-2)

Throughout the [Clone Wars](/wiki/Clone_Wars "Clone Wars") between the [Galactic Republic](/wiki/Galactic_Republic "Galactic Republic") and the [Confederacy of Independent Systems](/wiki/Confederacy_of_Independent_Systems "Confederacy of Independent Systems"), Clone Force 99 had a 100% percent success rate in their missions, but had a reputation for their unorthodox methods and disobedience.[[2]](#cite_note-The_Bad_Batch-2) Hunter lost count of the amount of missions they had completed, feeling that the action blurred together.[[9]](#cite_note-A_Distant_Echo-9) The Force was known throughout the [Grand Army of the Republic](/wiki/Grand_Army_of_the_Republic "Grand Army of the Republic") to [clone troopers](/wiki/Clone_trooper "Clone trooper") such as [Jesse](/wiki/Jesse "Jesse") and [Kix](/wiki/Kix "Kix"), although [Clone Captain](/wiki/Clone_Captain "Clone Captain") [Rex](/wiki/Rex "Rex") had not heard of them. At some point in the war, Hunter met [Clone Commander](/wiki/Clone_Commander "Clone Commander") [Cody](/wiki/Cody "Cody"), and Clone Force 99 was given at least one suicide mission by him,[[2]](#cite_note-The_Bad_Batch-2) but the members could not articulate who their regular superior officer was.[[9]](#cite_note-A_Distant_Echo-9) The members of Clone Force 99 also met and bonded with the [family](/wiki/Lawquane_family "Lawquane family") of the clone deserter [Cut Lawquane](/wiki/Cut_Lawquane "Cut Lawquane") on [Saleucami](/wiki/Saleucami "Saleucami") during the war.[[10]](#cite_note-Cut_and_Run-10)

#### Mirror match[]

:   "*I've got movement, this way. And whatever it is‚Ä¶it's* fast*. I can't get a lock on it.*"
:   ‚ÄïHunter, alerting the squad of an unknown threat[[11]](#cite_note-Hyperspace_Stories_10-11)

Sometime between [21 BBY](/wiki/21_BBY "21 BBY") and [19 BBY](/wiki/19_BBY "19 BBY"),[[12]](#cite_note-Hylanth_Date-12) Hunter and the rest of Clone Force 99 were present during an [attack](/wiki/Attack_on_a_Republic_fleet "Attack on a Republic fleet") on a Republic [fleet](/wiki/Fleet "Fleet"). During the battle, Wrecker stumbled upon a [Wookiee doll](/wiki/Viiveenn%27s_doll "Viiveenn's doll"), getting himself distracted. Unbeknownst to the squad, the [doll](/wiki/Doll "Doll") was owned by the [Wookiee](/wiki/Wookiee "Wookiee") [Viiveenn](/wiki/Viiveenn "Viiveenn"), who just left the chaotic scene with [Jedi Master](/wiki/Jedi_Master "Jedi Master") [Obi-Wan Kenobi](/wiki/Obi-Wan_Kenobi "Obi-Wan Kenobi").

Tech reminded Wrecker that they were still in the middle of a battle. Wrecker and Crosshair then got into an argument about whether or not they should bring the lost doll with them. At the [ramp](/wiki/Entry_ramp "Entry ramp") of the *Marauder*, Hunter interrupted the three clones, telling them to get a move on for their next assignment, a [mission](/wiki/Mission_to_Hylanth "Mission to Hylanth") to the [Outer Rim](/wiki/Outer_Rim_Territories "Outer Rim Territories") [moon](/wiki/Moon "Moon") [Hylanth](/wiki/Hylanth "Hylanth").[[11]](#cite_note-Hyperspace_Stories_10-11)

 [![Clone Force 99 arrives on Hylanth](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/d/de/CloneForce99OnHylanth-HyperspaceStories10.png/revision/latest?cb=20240624084915) [![Clone Force 99 arrives on Hylanth](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/d/de/CloneForce99OnHylanth-HyperspaceStories10.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/275?cb=20240624084915)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/d/de/CloneForce99OnHylanth-HyperspaceStories10.png/revision/latest?cb=20240624084915) 

Clone Force 99 arrives on Hylanth

 

After the *Marauder* landed on the moon, the squad got out of their ship and was surrounded by forests. They were sent out due to [battle droids](/wiki/Battle_droid "Battle droid"), which made Crosshair question the whole mission, stating that even regular clone troopers could handle it. Tech then added that the [droids](/wiki/Droid "Droid") were modified, though who was responsible for the modifications remained unknown, making Crosshair slightly more optimistic about their mission as he walked through the forest. Wrecker said that Crosshair just needed some cheering up and attempted to cheer him up, teasing the [marksman](/wiki/Sniper "Sniper") with the Wookiee doll he had found earlier. The pair argued, though Hunter interrupted the argument, telling them both to be quiet. Hunter noticed a movement, though it was too fast for him to get a lock on.[[11]](#cite_note-Hyperspace_Stories_10-11)

As the squad walked further into the forest, both Hunter and Crosshair felt that something was wrong with their mission. A [hologram](/wiki/Hologram "Hologram") then appeared out of nowhere, greeting the clones before introducing himself, [Doctor](/wiki/Doctor "Doctor") [Krail](/wiki/Krail "Krail"). The doctor hoped that the Republic would send them, to which Hunter asked why Krail hoped for them to come specifically. Krail proceeded to compare the clones to battle droids but was interrupted by Wrecker, saying that they were nothing alike. The doctor agreed, calling the clones special and better than the rest, adding that it was the same as his battle droids. Being very confident, Wrecker challenged Krail to send out his special droids, which the doctor already sent earlier.[[11]](#cite_note-Hyperspace_Stories_10-11)

#### A distant Echo[]

##### Summoned to Anaxes[]

:   "*Sergeant, good to see you again."  
    "You too sir."  
    "This is Hunter."  
    "Sorry we're late commander, we were putting down an insurrection on Yalbec Prime when your comm came in. Had a few unforseen‚Ä¶complications.*"
:   ‚ÄïCody and Hunter upon Clone Force 99's arrival on Anaxes[[2]](#cite_note-The_Bad_Batch-2)

 [![Hunter and The Bad Batch on Anaxes](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/f/fd/Hunter_on_Anaxes.png/revision/latest?cb=20210505021458) [![Hunter and The Bad Batch on Anaxes](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/f/fd/Hunter_on_Anaxes.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20210505021458)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/f/fd/Hunter_on_Anaxes.png/revision/latest?cb=20210505021458) 

Hunter and The Bad Batch on Anaxes

 

In 19 [BBY](/wiki/%27ABY-BBY%27_dating_system "'ABY-BBY' dating system"),[[13]](#cite_note-Timelines-13) Clone Force 99 was fighting an [Insurrection on Yalbec Prime](/wiki/Insurrection_on_Yalbec_Prime "Insurrection on Yalbec Prime"), where Wrecker cut off the [Yalbec](/wiki/Yalbec "Yalbec") [queen's](/wiki/Unidentified_Yalbec_queen "Unidentified Yalbec queen") [stinger](/wiki/Yalbec_queen_stinger "Yalbec queen stinger"), causing the males of the species to try to [mate](/wiki/Reproduction "Reproduction") with them. During the insurrection, Commander Cody transmitted a request for Clone Force 99 to arrive on [Anaxes](/wiki/Anaxes "Anaxes"). The Republic was losing the [Battle of Anaxes](/wiki/Battle_of_Anaxes "Battle of Anaxes"), and to turn the tide, Captain Rex and Cody plotted an attack with a small squad on a Separatist [Cyber Center](/wiki/Cyber_Center "Cyber Center"), with Cody selecting The Bad Batch for the mission. The squad nearly crashed the *Marauder* as it flew at high speed into [Fort Anaxes](/wiki/Fort_Anaxes "Fort Anaxes").

Hunter exited the [starship](/wiki/Starship "Starship") first and apologized for their tardiness, explaining their encounter with the Yalbecs as an "unforeseen complication." The sergeant vouched for the flaws and abilities of his brothers before inquiring about the nature of their mission, boarding a [Low Altitude Assault Transport/infantry](/wiki/Low_Altitude_Assault_Transport/infantry "Low Altitude Assault Transport/infantry") gunship and getting briefed en route to their destination.[[2]](#cite_note-The_Bad_Batch-2)

##### Infiltrating Separatist bases[]

:   "*Everyone, find cover. We'll hold this position and let them come to us."  
    "I don't think so, Captain. That's not our style. We prefer going to them. Bad Batch! Plan 82, "Shockwave!"*"
:   ‚ÄïRex and Hunter after being shot down[[2]](#cite_note-The_Bad_Batch-2)

The gunship was shot down by [DSD1 dwarf spider droids](/wiki/DSD1_dwarf_spider_droid "DSD1 dwarf spider droid"), crashing in a canyon. Cody was trapped within the wreckage, and when Rex tried to help his friend Hunter stopped him and ordered Wrecker to help. Wrecker used his immense strength to lift the entire gunship and pull Cody out. Afterwards the clones saw an [army](/wiki/Army "Army") of [B1-series battle droid](/wiki/B1-series_battle_droid "B1-series battle droid") advancing towards them, and Rex advocated making a stand there. Hunter disagreed, as Clone Force 99 had their own methods and preferred taking the fight to the enemy. Hunter called out for [Plan 82](/wiki/Plan_82 "Plan 82"), shockwave, where the unit worked as a team, with Wrecker providing cover with a large piece of the gunship, and Tech calculating positions for Hunter to throw [Electro Magnetic Pulse grenades](/wiki/Electromagnetic_pulse_grenade "Electromagnetic pulse grenade") at, which were shot by Crosshair to disable a wide field of droids. As more spider droids advanced Hunter gave the order to fan out, fighting droids with his [DC-17 hand blaster](/wiki/DC-17_repeater_hand_blaster "DC-17 repeater hand blaster") and [vibro-knife](/wiki/Vibroknife "Vibroknife"). With the droids eliminated Rex complemented Hunter on the squad's work and suggested that they move out from their compromised position.[[2]](#cite_note-The_Bad_Batch-2)

At a camp, Jesse inquired as to what Hunter's genetic enhancement was, with Kix joking that it was ability to put up with the other three. Tech explained Hunter's abilities to sense electromagnetic frequencies and stated that unlike maps, Hunter was never wrong. With Cody incapacitated, Rex took command of the mission, escalating tensions between Clone Force 99 and Rex's men to the point of a near brawl. Hunter had to step in to get Wrecker to put down Kix, and chastised the men for their actions and focused on the mission, agreeing to follow Rex's lead and complete the mission his way. When the clones arrived at a Separatist [outpost](/wiki/Anaxes_Separatist_Security_Outpost "Anaxes Separatist Security Outpost") that was easier to attack than evade, Hunter asked for Rex's orders, expecting an infiltration mission, but the captain agreed to lead a frontal assault in Bad Batch style, which excited Hunter. The clones broke into the Center and rode an elevator up to the command tower, eliminating many droids along the way. Hunter complemented Rex, that he was not bad for a "Reg"; a term the Bad Batch used for the rank-and-file clones.[[2]](#cite_note-The_Bad_Batch-2)

##### A lost clone[]

:   "*If you want my opinion, it sounds like a trap, but me and the boys will tag along anyway, if only to say "I told you so."*"
:   ‚ÄïHunter to Rex and Anakin Skywalker[[9]](#cite_note-A_Distant_Echo-9)

 [![Hunter, Tech, and Wrecker plan an assault on the Separatist outpost](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/2/2f/Bad_Batch_scouting.png/revision/latest?cb=20210507130251) [![Hunter, Tech, and Wrecker plan an assault on the Separatist outpost](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/2/2f/Bad_Batch_scouting.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20210507130251)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/2/2f/Bad_Batch_scouting.png/revision/latest?cb=20210507130251) 

Hunter, Tech, and Wrecker plan an assault on the Separatist outpost

 

From the outpost the clones spotted the Cyber Center, and Tech discovered a [platoon](/wiki/Platoon "Platoon") of droids heading there. Hunter correctly theorized that their destruction at the crash site had been noticed. To infiltrate the outpost the clones Hunter, Tech, and Wrecker stole [speeder bikes](/wiki/Speeder_bike "Speeder bike") to flank the Separatists from the rear while the other clones attacked the entrance. After Wrecker broke down the back door, the three clones entered the base and gunned down the B1 battle droids inside. Inside the base's command center, Hunter attacked two [T-series](/wiki/T-series_military_strategic_analysis_and_tactics_droid "T-series military strategic analysis and tactics droid") [tactical droids](/wiki/Tactical_droid "Tactical droid") with his vibro-knife, leaving Tech to analyze the Separatist computers while he and Wrecker joined the assault at the entrance. After the squad eliminated the B1 battle droids, a [Multi-Troop Transport](/wiki/Multi-Troop_Transport "Multi-Troop Transport") arrived and dropped off a host of [B2-series super battle droids](/wiki/B2-series_super_battle_droid "B2-series super battle droid"). The droids pushed the clones back inside the Cyber Center, where Hunter had to forcefully recall a stunned Rex to back out. After being pushed outside the Center, the clones were picked up by Crosshair driving a stolen [Separatist airspeeder](/wiki/Separatist_airspeeder "Separatist airspeeder"). On returning to Fort Anaxes, Rex revealed that the Separatists tactical advantage was caused by [CT-1409](/wiki/Echo "Echo"), an [Advanced Recon Commando](/wiki/Advanced_Recon_Commando "Advanced Recon Commando") nicknamed "Echo" who was long believed to be [dead](/wiki/Battle_of_Lola_Sayu "Battle of Lola Sayu").[[2]](#cite_note-The_Bad_Batch-2)

At the base, plans for a [mission](/wiki/Mission_to_Skako_Minor_(Clone_Wars) "Mission to Skako Minor (Clone Wars)") to the source of Echo's signals on the planet [Skako Minor](/wiki/Skako_Minor "Skako Minor") were made. Hunter met [Jedi Knight](/wiki/Jedi_Knight "Jedi Knight") [Anakin Skywalker](/wiki/Anakin_Skywalker "Anakin Skywalker") and expressed concern that the general staff had not sanctioned the mission, on account on its far-fetched nature. Skywalker was certain that it would be approved and that the primary objective was to uncover the Separatists' strategic advantages, regardless of Echo's involvement. Hunter offered Clone Force 99 to the mission, if only to allow an "I told you so." Skywalker and Rex left so the [Jedi](/wiki/Jedi "Jedi") could contact his secret [wife](/wiki/Marriage "Marriage") [Padm√© Amidala](/wiki/Padm%C3%A9_Amidala "Padm√© Amidala"), while Hunter returned to wait at the *Marauder* with the Bad Batch. On the way to Skako Minor Rex and Skywalker asked about the Force's nature, with Hunter unsure of the amount of missions they had undertaken or who they regularly reported to.[[9]](#cite_note-A_Distant_Echo-9)

##### The Poletecs of Skako Minor[]

:   "*What are you doing?"  
    "Going for a ride.*"
:   ‚ÄïRex and Hunter, as the later flies into the air to rescue Anakin Skywalker[[9]](#cite_note-A_Distant_Echo-9)

 [![Hunter attempting to rescue Anakin Skywalker](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/7/78/Hunter_air_rescue.png/revision/latest?cb=20210507140719) [![Hunter attempting to rescue Anakin Skywalker](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/7/78/Hunter_air_rescue.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20210507140719)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/7/78/Hunter_air_rescue.png/revision/latest?cb=20210507140719) 

Hunter attempting to rescue Anakin Skywalker

 

As the *Marauder* approached Skako Minor, Tech called out that it would be a difficult landing, leading everyone to strap in. As the crew landed and discussed the world's native [Poletecs](/wiki/Poletec "Poletec"), one riding a winged [keeradak](/wiki/Keeradak "Keeradak") landed on the ship and caused it to shake violently. Hunter wanted the creature removed from his ship and ran outside, followed by the crew. More mounted keeradaks arrived as they tried to force the keeradak off, and one grabbed Skywalker and flew off. Crosshair shot a grapple onto it, which Hunter grabbed and informed Rex he was going for a ride. The clone was pulled into the air and began shooting at the keeradak's [rider](/wiki/Qin_Yazal "Qin Yazal") with his [blaster](/wiki/Blaster "Blaster"), which he dropped when the rider maneuvered out of his aim. As the keeradaks and Poletecs neared their [village](/wiki/Poletec_village "Poletec village") Hunter detached his cable and landed on a ridge overlooking the settlement. He contacted Tech via [comlink](/wiki/Comlink "Comlink") and informed Clone Force 99 to hone in on his signal.[[9]](#cite_note-A_Distant_Echo-9)

When they arrived Hunter informed them that the tribesmen were holding Skywalker, and Rex instructed them that they would move in and only disarm the Poletecs without casualties. Wrecker rolled a boulder down a cliff into the village, with the clones following behind. Hunter pointed his blaster at the [chief](/wiki/Chief "Chief"), the one who had abducted Skywalker, and ordered Tech to translate the [language](/wiki/Poletec_language "Poletec language") through his gear. The translation revealed that Skywalker had only been taken because the Poletecs wanted to avoid further warfare on their planet, as had already been propagated by the presence of [Techno Union](/wiki/Techno_Union "Techno Union") [Foreman](/wiki/Foreman "Foreman") and [Separatist Council](/wiki/Executive_Separatist_Council "Executive Separatist Council") member [Wat Tambor](/wiki/Wat_Tambor "Wat Tambor"). The Poletecs agreed to escort the clones and Skywalker to Tambor's headquarters in the [city](/wiki/City "City") of [Purkoll](/wiki/Purkoll "Purkoll"). At a vantage point overlooking the city Hunter and Crosshair both gave knowing looks at Wrecker when Skywalker expressed hope that none of them were afraid of heights. When Tech observed that the signal thought to belong to Echo had disappeared, Hunter suggested that the signal may have been a trap and that Echo was truly dead.[[9]](#cite_note-A_Distant_Echo-9)

##### Finding Echo[]

:   "*I hope you find what you're looking for, captain.*"
:   ‚ÄïHunter to Rex, before the latter finds Echo[[9]](#cite_note-A_Distant_Echo-9)

Rex reacted angrily when Crosshair suggested his guilt over leaving Echo at the [Citadel](/wiki/Citadel "Citadel") was driving the mission, leading Skywalker to instruct Hunter to take Clone Force 99 to look for an entrance while he discussed the matter privately with Rex. The commandos found an entrance to a [tower base](/wiki/Purkoll_Tower_Base "Purkoll Tower Base") before Skywalker and Rex arrived; when they did Hunter informed them that Echo's signal was restored. The group took an [turbolift](/wiki/Turbolift "Turbolift") up the tower and Skywalker's instructions to keep the mission quiet were ignored. Clone Force 99 blasted their way out of the turbolift and destroyed a group of [D1-series aerial battle droids](/wiki/D1-series_aerial_battle_droid "D1-series aerial battle droid") in the room they opened up to. Outside the room, Tech realized that Echo's signal was only present when he was transmitting data, leading Skywalker to split up the group to search every room in the tower. Hunter ran with Rex, Tech, and Wrecker.[[9]](#cite_note-A_Distant_Echo-9)

 [![Clone Force 99 surrounded by droids](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/e/ee/Hunter_and_co_surrounded.png/revision/latest?cb=20210507141204) [![Clone Force 99 surrounded by droids](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/e/ee/Hunter_and_co_surrounded.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/300?cb=20210507141204)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/e/ee/Hunter_and_co_surrounded.png/revision/latest?cb=20210507141204) 

Clone Force 99 surrounded by droids

 

When the signal returned, Hunter identified the room it emanated from. As the group tried to enter it a transmission from Tambor appeared on a [viewscreen](/wiki/Viewscreen "Viewscreen"), with the foreman stating that the clones' movements had been predictable and that Echo was gone, his mind a prisoner of the Separatists. A large group of aerial battle droids surrounded the clones and were ordered by Tambor to [execute](/wiki/Death "Death") them. Hunter threw his knife to deactivate one droid and destroyed several in the group with his knife and blaster, along with Skywalker and Crosshair, who had joined them. After the initial group was destroyed Skywalker ordered Tech to open the door for Rex, and Hunter expressed his hope that the captain found what he sought. Rex found Echo indeed, wired into machinery in suspended animation.[[9]](#cite_note-A_Distant_Echo-9)

##### Escaping the tower[]

:   "*Hunter, hold them off. I'll check on Rex and Echo.*"
:   ‚ÄïAnakin Skywalker to Hunter[[14]](#cite_note-On_the_Wings_of_Keeradaks-14)

More D1 battle droids arrived and were fought off by Hunter, Skywalker, Wrecker, and Crosshair. The Jedi ordered Hunter to continue the defense while he checked on Tech and Rex. The three clones were pushed into the room where Echo was held and closed the door, with Hunter and Crosshair using welders to seal it. As more droids surrounded the entrance Crosshair explained the amount of droids entering, with Hunter stating they could hold them off as long as necessary. The sergeant sealed another door leading into the room as the Separatists began piercing the first one with a [decimator](/wiki/S/D_Decimator_droid "S/D Decimator droid") droid. Rex and Tech were able to unplug Echo from the machinery, in which time the lost clone identified a roof exhaust vent through which they could escape. Echo unlocked the vent using his cybernetic attachments, and Hunter exclaimed that the Decimator had nearly breached through the second door. To reach the vent Wrecker threw Hunter upwards first, who complained that a warning would have been appreciated.[[14]](#cite_note-On_the_Wings_of_Keeradaks-14)

Wrecker threw the other members of the squad into the vent and threw [thermal detonators](/wiki/Thermal_detonator "Thermal detonator") to destroy the decimator. As the squad navigated the exhaust pipes Echo explained that he had been given access to [Techno Union](/wiki/Techno_Union "Techno Union") databases, including building schematics. Echo led the group to a large outdoor pipe at a great height, where Hunter tried to assure the acrophobic Wrecker that they were near safety. However, D-1 battle droids surrounded the clones on both sides of the pipe. Tech used a recording of the keeradaks to summon the creatures to their location, where the clones and Skywalker jumped on the keeradaks to escape. Hunter and Tech were the last to jump, riding on the same keeradak. Hunter took the role of steering the creature while Tech fired back at the D1 droids, who pursued them in flight.[[14]](#cite_note-On_the_Wings_of_Keeradaks-14)

##### Defending the village[]

:   "*It's hard to compete with a Jedi.*"
:   ‚ÄïHunter after repelling the droids from the Poletec village[[14]](#cite_note-On_the_Wings_of_Keeradaks-14)

Clone Force 99 returned to the Poletec village, unwittingly drawing the battle droids there. The Poletec chief was furious that war had come to their village, but Rex explained what the Techno Union had done to Echo and that it was time for the Poletecs to take a stand. As a large force of droids arrived at the village the inhabitants and clones united to fight them off, with Hunter dispatching several with his vibro-knife. After many D1 droids were defeated several [Octuptarra tri-droids](/wiki/Octuptarra_tri-droid "Octuptarra tri-droid") wrought havoc on the villagers. Rex led Hunter and Wrecker to fire at the droids from below, and after Skywalker's effective strategy of jumping onto the droids and damaging them up close was demonstrated, Wrecker threw Hunter and Rex onto one of the droids to deal with them.[[14]](#cite_note-On_the_Wings_of_Keeradaks-14)

With the Octuptarra droids brought down Wrecker helped Hunter up, and the sergeant complimented Skywalker's abilities. The Poletec sand the clones thanked each other for their assistance as Clone Force 99 boarded the *Marauder*[[14]](#cite_note-On_the_Wings_of_Keeradaks-14) to return to Anaxes.[[15]](#cite_note-Unfinished_Business-15)

##### Liberating Anaxes[]

:   "*And the regs think we take risks.*"
:   ‚ÄïHunter after learning Echo's plan[[15]](#cite_note-Unfinished_Business-15)

After returning to Fort Anaxes, Echo formulated a plan to restore the planet to Republic control. Jedi General [Mace Windu](/wiki/Mace_Windu "Mace Windu") would lead a force to retake the planet's [assembly complex](/wiki/Anaxes_assembly_complex "Anaxes assembly complex"), while Clone Force 99 along with Skywalker and Rex would escort Echo to Separatist [Admiral](/wiki/Admiral "Admiral") [Trench](/wiki/Trench "Trench")'s flagship, *[Invulnerable](/wiki/Invulnerable "Invulnerable")*, where the clone could give false strategies to the Separatists. At the *Marauder*, Hunter asked Tech if they were ready to begin, which Tech answered in the affirmative. Aboard the ship Hunter inquired about Echo's plan, which was to transmit a code identifying the vessel to the flagship as a droid shuttle. Hunter commented that the plan was risky, even by Bad Batch standards.[[15]](#cite_note-Unfinished_Business-15)

Inside the ship, Echo engaged with the interface in the comm vault to complete the plan. Echo sent a message to Trench to send all droid forces to the assembly complex, which Hunter was suspicious of as that would outnumber the forces led by Windu and Kenobi. True to his loyalties, Echo transmitted a signal to deactivate all of the droids at the assembly complex, turning the various battlefronts on Anaxes in the Republic's favor. Hunter was glad to learn that Echo had not been compromised by the Separatists. As Echo discovered and helped Windu disarm a bomb hidden in the assembly complex, Trench's droids discovered the signal originating within their ship and blocked it, knocking out Echo. Hunter realized that meant Trench knew their location, and the clones began to fight their way out of the vault against a horde of B2 super battle droids and B1 battle droids.[[15]](#cite_note-Unfinished_Business-15)

##### Victory[]

:   "*Your path is different, like ours. If you ever feel like you don't fit in with them, well, find us.*"
:   ‚ÄïHunter to Echo after the victory on Anaxes[[15]](#cite_note-Unfinished_Business-15)

 [![The Bad Batch salutes Rex, alongside their newest member](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/2/24/Clone_Force_99_plus_Echo.png/revision/latest?cb=20200318003054) [![The Bad Batch salutes Rex, alongside their newest member](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/2/24/Clone_Force_99_plus_Echo.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/275?cb=20200318003054)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/2/24/Clone_Force_99_plus_Echo.png/revision/latest?cb=20200318003054) 

The Bad Batch salutes Rex, alongside their newest member

 

As they progressed through the ship's halls Wrecker cleared a path by rampaging through lines of droids with only his hands, at which Hunter expressed a level of empathy for his victims. As Skywalker, who had gone to retrieve the final part of the bomb's code from Trench, returned, Crosshair demolished a large number of droids by placing reflective pads on the ship's walls, ricocheting his blaster-fire throughout the walls. Wrecker was dismayed that his feat was outdone, but Hunter assured him that he would win next time, which Crosshair disputed. The clones escaped from Trench's flagship aboard the *Marauder*, and on returning to Fort Anaxes they were commended for their actions by Windu, as they had saved Anaxes. Kenobi commented that [medals](/wiki/Unidentified_medal_(Battle_of_Anaxes) "Unidentified medal (Battle of Anaxes)") were in store for them.[[15]](#cite_note-Unfinished_Business-15)

When the members of Clone Force 99 did not join Rex and the Jedi to receive their accolades, Echo inquired as to why. The clones responded that it was not their "thing" and Hunter asked Echo if he felt the same way. He identified that Echo's path had changed from that of the regular clones, and was welcome to join them if he could find them. Rex advised Echo to accept Hunter's offer, which he did. The members of Clone Force 99 showed their respect to Rex by saluting him, along with their newest recruit.[[15]](#cite_note-Unfinished_Business-15)

#### The cavalry on Kaller[]

##### Saving the day[]

:   "*Any orders? Or shall we do what we do?*"
:   ‚ÄïHunter to Depa Billaba[[5]](#cite_note-Aftermath-5)

As the war drew to a close, Hunter and Clone Force 99 were stationed on the planet [Kaller](/wiki/Kaller "Kaller"), where Republic forces led by Jedi General [Depa Billaba](/wiki/Depa_Billaba "Depa Billaba") were [pinned down](/wiki/Battle_of_Kaller "Battle of Kaller") by the droid army. Billaba's [Padawan](/wiki/Padawan "Padawan") [Caleb Dume](/wiki/Kanan_Jarrus "Kanan Jarrus") was sent to find reinforcements and recruited Clone Force 99, who rolled a boulder down a hill onto the oncoming battle droids. Hunter and Clone Force 99 then emerged from the [forest](/wiki/Forest "Forest"), with Hunter using his vibro-knife and blaster. Hunter then ordered Crosshair to deal with the [Armored Assault Tanks](/wiki/Armored_Assault_Tank_Mk_I "Armored Assault Tank Mk I"), which he did by launching a cable between them, which allowed Wrecker to then push them off a nearby cliff. Clone Force 99 dealt with the remaining battle droids and returned to the Republic trenches, where Hunter suggested that Billaba launch a counterattack. Billaba's subordinate commander [CC-10/994](/wiki/Grey_(clone_trooper) "Grey (clone trooper)"), nicknamed "Grey" responded indignantly, reminding Hunter that the general was in command, but Billaba agreed and followed Hunter's advice.[[5]](#cite_note-Aftermath-5)

While Billaba's clones advanced Dume introduced his master to Clone Force 99, where she praised the force's abilities. She then inquired about the reinforcements that were expected, but Hunter explained that they were directed to the capital and that Clone Force 99 was their only provision. Tech then revealed that communications were anticipating the potential end of the war, as Jedi Master Kenobi was [engaging](/wiki/Battle_of_Utapau "Battle of Utapau") Separatist General [Grievous](/wiki/Grievous "Grievous") on [Utapau](/wiki/Utapau "Utapau"), where Republic victory could result in the collapse of the Confederate command structure. The clones knew they still had to continue fighting on Kaller, and Hunter asked Billaba if she had orders or if they could apply their demonstrated expertise. Billaba asked Dume, who enthusiastically asked if he could join Clone Force 99, although Hunter asked him if he was prepared to move quickly along with them.[[5]](#cite_note-Aftermath-5)

##### Order 66[]

:   "*What are you doing?*"  
    "*Following orders.*"  
    "*We don't even know what the order is.*"
:   ‚ÄïHunter and Crosshair, after the latter tried to kill Caleb Dume.[[5]](#cite_note-Aftermath-5)

Clone Force 99 did not have the chance to participate in further battles. As they ran into the fray, Grey received a transmission from [Supreme Chancellor](/wiki/Supreme_Chancellor "Supreme Chancellor") [Sheev Palpatine](/wiki/Darth_Sidious "Darth Sidious") to execute Order 66, an instruction given to clones to terminate the Jedi that was mandated by the inhibitor chips. Dume rushed back to help Billaba, who was surrounded by hostile clones, which the members of Clone Force 99 noticed. From a distance they watched Billaba's death and ran back as Dume ran away, heeding his master's final instruction to run. The Padawan told the clones to stay away from him and ran into the forest, while Hunter called for him to wait. Hunter and the other Clone Force 99 members were unaffected by Order 66 due to their genetic enhancements, and so were confused by the sudden betrayal of the Jedi. Hunter ordered Tech and Echo to talk to Grey to learn what they could, while he and Crosshair followed Dume.[[5]](#cite_note-Aftermath-5)

 [![Hunter tried to keep Caleb Dume safe, unaware of the nature of Order 66](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/5/53/Hunter-talks-with-Caleb.png/revision/latest?cb=20211231055759) [![Hunter tried to keep Caleb Dume safe, unaware of the nature of Order 66](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/5/53/Hunter-talks-with-Caleb.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20211231055759)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/5/53/Hunter-talks-with-Caleb.png/revision/latest?cb=20211231055759) 

Hunter tried to keep Caleb Dume safe, unaware of the nature of Order 66

 

The two clones spotted Dume hiding in a treetop; Hunter called for him to come down, but Crosshair, who unlike his compatriots was affected by the inhibitor chips, fired on the Padawan who escaped further into the forest. Hunter asked what Crosshair was doing, to which the sniper insisted that he was following orders. Hunter told him to stand down as they were unclear on what the orders were, while Crosshair muttered the phrase "Good soldiers follow orders." After further pursuit, Tech explained via transmission that the clones had been ordered to execute the Jedi in response to treason, an explanation that satisfied Crosshair but left Hunter more confused. Crosshair spotted Dume again and knocked out the tree branch he was under. On the ground Dume and Crosshair fought while Hunter protested, with the clone being knocked down.[[5]](#cite_note-Aftermath-5)

Hunter told Dume to stay calm and that he was on his side, but Dume continued to run, unsure who to trust. The Padawan came to the edge of a ravine and turned to face Hunter, who removed his helmet and tried to explain that he was equally confused and not responsible for Billaba's death. Hunter asked Dume to come with him, but as the Padawan heard more clones coming he [jumped](/wiki/Force_jump "Force jump") over the ravine and escaped into the distance. Crosshair woke up and caught up to Hunter, who lied and said he had stunned the Jedi and caused him to fall into the ravine.[[5]](#cite_note-Aftermath-5)

### Age of the Empire[]

#### Return to Kamino[]

:   "*Is there a problem?*"  
    "*No problem. [...] We'll just head to our barracks then.*"  
    "*Best hurry. There's a mandatory general assembly at 1500.*"
:   ‚ÄïA clone shock trooper and Hunter, as the latter seeing a corpse of a Jedi being transported.[[5]](#cite_note-Aftermath-5)

As the *Marauder* returned to Kamino, Crosshair questioned Hunter on his version of events, noticing that the sergeant had not been looking down into the ravine as one would when something had fallen down there. Hunter brushed off Crosshair's interrogation, insisting that he did not enjoy looking. On their home planet Hunter found it odd that [clone shock troopers](/wiki/Imperial_shock_trooper "Imperial shock trooper") from the [Coruscant Guard](/wiki/Coruscant_Guard "Coruscant Guard") were present, and learned from one of them that the war had come to an end with Grievous' death on Utapau. Subsequently, as a pair of shock trooper pass by with a cover corpse on a stretcher, a lightsaber fell from it, leaving Clone Force 99 visibly disturbed by the shock trooper's callousness as he picked it up. Hunter quickly dismissed the same shock trooper's concern if there was problem and stated his squad would be returning to their barracks. While Clone Force 99 walked through [Tipoca City](/wiki/Tipoca_City "Tipoca City")'s halls, Hunter observed that all the other clones were acting strange. Tech attempted to test that theory as he attempted to get the attention of a random trooper only to be rudely shoved aside.[[5]](#cite_note-Aftermath-5)

Upon re-entering their barracks, in response to Echo's complaints about the ambient odor in the room, Hunter assured him he would get used to it in time, though Crosshair rudely shoved his way past to make his opinion clear. As Echo and Wrecker begin to debate whether their mission on Kaller was a success, Crosshair called out Hunter for allowing Dume to escape, to which he shamelessly stated he found it wrong to execute their commanders without question and grew suspicious when Crosshair insisted they had to follow orders.[[5]](#cite_note-Aftermath-5)

Echo then turned the argument around to the fact that Billaba's clones, who served her loyally for years, would just suddenly turn on her without a second thought. Tech then explained that all clones were programmed to obey orders without questions, but the genetic mutations of Clone Force 99 inadvertently rendered them immune to the effects of the programming. However, Hunter questioned why Echo wasn't affected, as he was a reg before he joined their squad, to which Tech theorized that the damage he sustained on Skako Minor most likely damaged his programming.[[5]](#cite_note-Aftermath-5)

The squad as soon summoned to a mass rally where they watched the [Proclamation of the New Order](/wiki/Proclamation_of_the_New_Order "Proclamation of the New Order") delivered by Palpatine, which transformed the Republic into the [Galactic Empire](/wiki/Galactic_Empire "Galactic Empire"). While listening to Palpatine's speech, Hunter spotted a young Human female standing next to [Nala Se](/wiki/Nala_Se "Nala Se"), who soon vanished when he was distracted by Tech. As they departed the assembly, Hunter remained silent as Echo and Tech briefly debated with Crosshair the change in galactic government when he sensed the same girl approaching them from behind. The girl introduced herself as [Omega](/wiki/Omega "Omega"), who was fascinated by the squad's exploits, addressing each member of the squad by name. As Hunter inquired the reason for her presence on Kamino, Nala Se interrupted, introducing the girl as her medical assistant. As the two parted the squad's presence, Hunter remarked that recent events have grown more and more strange.[[5]](#cite_note-Aftermath-5)

 [![Omega tried to befriend the Bad Batch, much to Hunter's confusion.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/0/0b/OmegaBadBatchCafeteria-Aftermath.png/revision/latest?cb=20220101060504) [![Omega tried to befriend the Bad Batch, much to Hunter's confusion.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/0/0b/OmegaBadBatchCafeteria-Aftermath.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20220101060504)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/0/0b/OmegaBadBatchCafeteria-Aftermath.png/revision/latest?cb=20220101060504) 

Omega tried to befriend the Bad Batch, much to Hunter's confusion.

 

At a mess hall, Hunter overheard other clones talking about an Imperial arriving to evaluate all the clones and informed his squad upon rejoining them. Suddenly, they were joined by Omega, much to their confusion, as no one ever willingly sat with them before. Confused by her determination to become closer to them, Hunter asked where her parents were. Before she could respond, a passing [clone](/wiki/Unidentified_clone_trooper_(cafeteria) "Unidentified clone trooper (cafeteria)") insulted Omega, provoking her into throwing food at the offending clone. Though Hunter managed to de-escalate the situation, Wrecker threw an entire tray for no reason, triggering a brawl that resulted in Echo being knocked.[[5]](#cite_note-Aftermath-5)

Clone Force 99 later came to visit Echo in the med bay, where he was being overseen by Omega and [AZI-345211896246498721347](/wiki/AZI-345211896246498721347 "AZI-345211896246498721347"). As AZ-3 departed, Echo informed everyone that he spotted Admiral [Wilhuff Tarkin](/wiki/Wilhuff_Tarkin "Wilhuff Tarkin") in the mess hall and forewarned he wasn't a supporter of clones. Hunter informed him that they had been summoned by Prime Minister Lama Su. Though Omega insisted on joining them to take responsibility for the food fight, Hunter told her to keep her distance from his squad.[[5]](#cite_note-Aftermath-5)

 [![Tarkin observed Hunter and the other Bad Batch members' unconventional methods of fighting.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/4/4c/TarkinTBB.png/revision/latest?cb=20210508024631) [![Tarkin observed Hunter and the other Bad Batch members' unconventional methods of fighting.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/4/4c/TarkinTBB.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20210508024631)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/4/4c/TarkinTBB.png/revision/latest?cb=20210508024631) 

Tarkin observed Hunter and the other Bad Batch members' unconventional methods of fighting.

 

Just as Clone Force 99 left the med bay, a squad of shock troopers informed them that they were to report to the training area, as Tarkin wanted to see them in action. To test their mettle, Clone Force 99 took part in a training simulation, which Tarkin escalated to have them fight against live rounds. With their training blasters useless against the new droids, Hunter signaled Tech and Wrecker to recreate a maneuver they used on [Felucia](/wiki/Felucia "Felucia"). As Hunter and Crosshair drew the majority of the droids' fire, Wrecker, Tech and Echo isolated and reprogrammed one to use its blaster-fire against its compatriots. As the squad seized the momentum, Hunter took down one droid with three stabs of his knife and cut off the arms of a second. However, as one last hostile droid dispatched the reprogrammed unit, knocking Tech off it, Hunter threw his knife at the droid's abdomen, prompting it to fire on him and Crosshair. Ultimately, Crosshair was able to shoot Wrecker's knife into the droid's head, ending the simulation.[[5]](#cite_note-Aftermath-5)

#### A change of heart[]

##### Mission to Onderon[]

:   "*So, the newly declared Empire sent you to wipe us out?*"  
    "*Well, we're here to neutralize a group of insurgents.*"  
    "*Well... Here we are. What are you gonna do? Strike us down like you did the Jedi? [...] Why don't you take a look at the insurgents you were sent to destroy?*"
:   ‚ÄïSaw Gerrera and Hunter, the latter discovering the real nature of his mission.[[5]](#cite_note-Aftermath-5)

As they return to their barracks, the squad began to argue with Crosshair at being thrown into a live fire simulation without warning when they were interrupted by Tarkin, forcing them to stand at attention. The Admiral stated that Nala Se spoke highly of her five enhanced clones and assigned them to deal with insurgent forces on [Onderon](/wiki/Onderon "Onderon"), but gave minimal information about their targets. Prior to the mission, Omega had met Hunter at the docking bay and warned him not to trust Tarkin, but he brushed off her concerns.[[5]](#cite_note-Aftermath-5)

 [![The Bad Batch was captured by Saw Gerrera's partisan but was later released.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/2/2a/Saw-BadBatch-Aftermath.png/revision/latest?cb=20230129221216) [![The Bad Batch was captured by Saw Gerrera's partisan but was later released.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/2/2a/Saw-BadBatch-Aftermath.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20230129221216)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/2/2a/Saw-BadBatch-Aftermath.png/revision/latest?cb=20230129221216) 

The Bad Batch was captured by Saw Gerrera's partisan but was later released.

 

Upon landing on Onderon, Hunter led his squad towards the supposed Separatist encampment, only to find civilians in place of battle droids. Though most of the squad was confused by this development, Crosshair insisted that Hunter give the order to engagement, but Hunter ordered them to stand down, sensing they were being surrounded by guerrilla fighters. They were then brought to the encampment, where they met [Saw Gerrera](/wiki/Saw_Gerrera "Saw Gerrera"), who informed the clones of the nature of the new Empire and that he was preparing for [civil war](/wiki/Galactic_Civil_War "Galactic Civil War"), despite Hunter noting that Gerrera's rebellion wouldn't stand a chance against the Empire. Gerrera let the clones leave to choose their own path while his people evacuated.[[5]](#cite_note-Aftermath-5)

At the *Marauder* the clones discussed the developments, with Crosshair expressing contempt for his squad-mates' disobedience, suggesting that Hunter was no longer fit to lead their squad. Hunter soon shot down an Imperial probe droid and realized he should have listened to Omega, whom Tech identified as the fifth enhanced clone Nala Se was referring to. Hunter then made it their new mission to rescue Omega, despite Crosshair's objections.[[5]](#cite_note-Aftermath-5)

##### Escape from Kamino[]

Upon landing at Tipoca City, the Bad Batch was about to split up to find Omega only to be surrounded by shock troopers as Tarkin accused them of treason and had them imprisoned, where they found Omega in their cell, having been arrested for trespassing in their barracks. Hunter soon became the target of Crosshair's criticism, blaming his decisions for landing them in prison. Hunter told him to stow the debate for later while they figure a way to escape. Unfortunately, Crosshair was taken out to have his inhibitor chip analyzed and its effects enhanced.[[5]](#cite_note-Aftermath-5)

Tech soon figured that their cell wasn't fit to hold Wrecker and had him punch a weak point in the wall while the others formed a line to keep his actions concealed. This created an opening large enough for Omega to slip through and she followed Hunter's instructions to make her way through the vents to get to the power switch for the ray shield. Unfortunately, a trio of shock troopers quickly notice Omega's absence, so Hunter claimed ignorance. When the troopers confirmed with the operations center that Omega was still in the detention block, the girl came crashing down from the vent before deactivating the ray shield. After stunning the shock troopers, Hunter stated they needed to find Crosshair, though Tech noted they wouldn't get far without their gear. Fortunately, Omega revealed their gear was moved to the *Marauder's* hanger, so the Bad Batch went there first.[[5]](#cite_note-Aftermath-5)

 [![The Bad Batch, accompanied by Omega, ran away from Kamino, forced to leave Crosshair behind.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/c/ce/OmegaEscapeFromKamino-Aftermath.png/revision/latest?cb=20220101212145) [![The Bad Batch, accompanied by Omega, ran away from Kamino, forced to leave Crosshair behind.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/c/ce/OmegaEscapeFromKamino-Aftermath.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20220101212145)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/c/ce/OmegaEscapeFromKamino-Aftermath.png/revision/latest?cb=20220101212145) 

The Bad Batch, accompanied by Omega, ran away from Kamino, forced to leave Crosshair behind.

 

Unfortunately, they were confronted by a squad of shock troopers led by none other than Crosshair. As he was criticized for disobeying Order 66, Hunter refused to deny that he did the right thing and refused to surrender. After a tense standoff, Hunter ducked to avoid Crosshair's shot as a blaster fight broke out. As the shock troopers threw smoke bombs, Hunter ordered Wrecker to clear the smoke, allowing him to take down the shock troopers only to be incapacitated by Crosshair. Hunter quickly seized Omega before she could run to Wrecker, warning that he was only using Wrecker as bait. He then ordered Omega to run for the *Marauder* while he and Echo retrieved Wrecker. This nearly left him an open target for Crosshair only to be narrowly saved by Omega, allowing the squad to board their ship and flee the city.[[5]](#cite_note-Aftermath-5)

While in [space](/wiki/Realspace "Realspace"), as Echo and Tech tended to Wrecker, Hunter noted Omega observing the viewscreen and learned that she had never been off Kamino. As the clones wondered where to go, Hunter stated he was hoping they could go into hiding, which would seem impossible with Crosshair gunning for them. Omega asked if they had any friends they could go to and Hunter affirmed that they knew someone at coordinates J-19.[[5]](#cite_note-Aftermath-5)

#### Visiting the deserter[]

As they traveled to [Saleucami](/wiki/Saleucami "Saleucami"), Hunter and Echo found Omega and Wrecker passed out after they had explored the ship together. While Hunter admired Omega's inquisitiveness, Echo reminded him that she is a child and questioned what to do with her. After landing on the planet, Hunter fondly watched as Omega took joy in things such as fresh air and dirt, having been raised on the water planet of Kamino her entire life. Eventually, the group arrived at [Cut Lawquane](/wiki/Cut_Lawquane "Cut Lawquane")'s [farm](/wiki/Lawquane%27s_Farm "Lawquane's Farm") and were welcomed in. Hunter introduced Echo and Omega to Cut and his [family](/wiki/Lawquane_family "Lawquane family"), and explained Crosshair's absence as being complicated. Cut revealed that Rex had passed through the previous day and spoke of behavioral modification chips causing clone troopers to turn on the Jedi, which Omega confirmed the existence of.[[10]](#cite_note-Cut_and_Run-10)

The conversation was then interrupted by the arrival of Cut's children, [Shaeeah](/wiki/Shaeeah_Lawquane "Shaeeah Lawquane") and [Jek](/wiki/Jek_Lawquane "Jek Lawquane"), whom Hunter encouraged Omega to play with. As they watched the children play catch, Cut questioned Omega's presence with the Bad Batch, suspecting that the Kaminoans created her for a specific purpose, but Hunter insisted it was irrelevant. The retired clone trooper revealed that he planned to move his family off-world to escape the Imperial occupation. Though Hunter offered to provide transport, Cut declined, reasoning that it was too risky to travel with wanted men.[[10]](#cite_note-Cut_and_Run-10)

 [![Shortly after the proclamation of the Empire, new rules were implemented, including chain codes to identify civilians.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/1/1e/ImperialChainCodeDecree-CaR.png/revision/latest?cb=20220102234317) [![Shortly after the proclamation of the Empire, new rules were implemented, including chain codes to identify civilians.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/1/1e/ImperialChainCodeDecree-CaR.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/275?cb=20220102234317)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/1/1e/ImperialChainCodeDecree-CaR.png/revision/latest?cb=20220102234317) 

Shortly after the proclamation of the Empire, new rules were implemented, including chain codes to identify civilians.

 

Later, Hunter and Cut headed into town to book a shuttle. Cut explained that the Imperials had begun impounding both civilian and military ships to prevent citizens from leaving Saleucami undocumented. While browsing produce, a vendor revealed to the duo that travel off-world was impossible due to the new [chain code](/wiki/Chain_code "Chain code") policy. Back at the homestead, Cut's children decided to stop playing after their ball rolled beyond the farm's perimeter. Omega, however decided to run after the ball and retrieve it. After she retrieved the ball, Omega was attacked by a [Nexu](/wiki/Nexu "Nexu"). Cut, [Suu](/wiki/Suu_Lawquane "Suu Lawquane"), Hunter, and Wrecker were alerted by the children and rushed to Omega's defense. After the predatory creature had been fended off, Hunter angrily reprimanded Omega for wandering off. Cut reminded Hunter that the girl was not a soldier, and instead comforted Omega. Fearing for her safety, Hunter ordered Tech to forge chain codes for Cut and his family, Omega included.[[10]](#cite_note-Cut_and_Run-10)

 [![Hunter and the Bad Batch eventually managed to leave Saleucami.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/f/fe/Escape_from_Saleucami.png/revision/latest?cb=20220102233149) [![Hunter and the Bad Batch eventually managed to leave Saleucami.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/f/fe/Escape_from_Saleucami.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20220102233149)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/f/fe/Escape_from_Saleucami.png/revision/latest?cb=20220102233149) 

Hunter and the Bad Batch eventually managed to leave Saleucami.

 

Subsequently, Hunter was informed over comlink that Tech and Echo had purposely called the Imperial authorities to have the *Marauder* seized to infiltrate the impound lot to acquire the chain codes, much to Hunter's outrage. Despite Tech's reassurances, Hunter informed them that Omega was on the ship. As Tech and Echo secured the codes, Hunter and Wrecker arrived at the checkpoint with Cut and his family.
