Omega attempted to sneak the codes to Hunter and Cut, but was discovered by an Imperial [Astromech](/wiki/Astromech_droid "Astromech droid") droid, and was subsequently saved by Wrecker. Omega managed to deliver the codes, but Hunter reluctantly convinced her to depart off-world with the Lawquanes for her own safety. Meanwhile, Tech, Echo, and Wrecker were discovered by clone stormtroopers and an intense firefight ensued. Hunter rendezvoused with his squad and proceeded to lay down covering fire as Echo and Wrecker attempted to demagnetize the clamps holding down their ship. Before the squad could depart, Omega appeared and ran for the ship, having decided to not leave with Cut and his family. Hunter dispatched the clone stormtroopers that attempted to subdue her and lead her aboard the ship. The group managed to lift off and escaped the planet.[[10]](#cite_note-Cut_and_Run-10)

Later, Omega apologized to Hunter and admitted that she had a lot to learn. Hunter admitted that he likewise had much to learn, and affirmed to Omega that she belonged with the squad.[[10]](#cite_note-Cut_and_Run-10)

#### Crash landing on Ordo Moon[]

 [![Tech and Echo outside replacing the energy capacitor.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/6/62/StrandedOnOrdoMoon-Replacements.png/revision/latest?cb=20220119021036) [![Tech and Echo outside replacing the energy capacitor.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/6/62/StrandedOnOrdoMoon-Replacements.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20220119021036)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/6/62/StrandedOnOrdoMoon-Replacements.png/revision/latest?cb=20220119021036) 

Tech and Echo outside replacing the energy capacitor.

 

The Bad Batch was traveling through [hyperspace](/wiki/Hyperspace "Hyperspace") when Hunter gave Omega and Wrecker some rations. A few moments later, they get thrown out of hyperspace. They crashed on [Ordo Moon](/wiki/Ordo_Moon "Ordo Moon"). Tech thinks their energy capacitor has sustained damage, but they have one spare on board. Omega grabs a box and asks if the energy capacitor is in there. Hunter said it was Crosshair's weapon kit. Wrecker admitted that he missed Crosshair. Tech and Echo then went outside to replace the energy capacitor. After replacing it, the two went inside the ship to report to Hunter that the capacitor was in place, but other systems were failing. The power then went out, and a creature ran across the viewport. Tech said it was an [Ordo Moon Dragon](/wiki/Ordo_Moon_Dragon "Ordo Moon Dragon"). Hunter told Tech and Echo to get the other systems online and Wrecker to stay on the ship.[[16]](#cite_note-Replacements-16)

Hunter and Omega made their way across the moon's surface. Hunter knelt to examine the dust, and Omega asked what he was doing. Hunter replied that he was tracking the missing capacitor, and Omega asked if she could learn to track like him. Hunter told Omega that he has a special mutation and that Tech and Wrecker each possess one. Omega added, "And Crosshair." Hunter scowled, and Omega told him they shouldn't be angry with him as he couldn't help it. Hunter replied that he was angry with himself for leaving Crosshair behind. Omega assured Hunter that they would find a way to get him back.[[16]](#cite_note-Replacements-16)

 [![Omega and Hunter tracking down the missing capacitor.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/d/df/HunterTrackCapacitor.png/revision/latest?cb=20230210084129) [![Omega and Hunter tracking down the missing capacitor.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/d/df/HunterTrackCapacitor.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/290?cb=20230210084129)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/d/df/HunterTrackCapacitor.png/revision/latest?cb=20230210084129) 

Omega and Hunter tracking down the missing capacitor.

 

Later, Hunter and Omega managed to locate the capacitor. As Hunter went to retrieve it, the Ordo Moon Dragon knocked him and ran away with the missing capacitor again. Hunter turned, gasping for air as his [breath mask](/wiki/Breath_mask "Breath mask") had been knocked off. Omega found his mask and put it back on, but Hunter was already unconscious. She tried to call for help but failed because of the ongoing storm that disrupted the signal. Omega watched as the dragon climbed into a burrow. Taking a deep breath, she grabbed Hunter's blaster and flashlight and slid down the burrow and into the tunnel.[[16]](#cite_note-Replacements-16)

Not long after, Hunter regained consciousness and looked around for Omega, calling her name. Omega realized that the dragon was attracted to the electric charge, so she handed the flashlight to the dragon. As the dragon absorbed the charge, she took the capacitor and made her way out of the tunnel.[[16]](#cite_note-Replacements-16)

With their ship repaired, the Bad Batch took off from the moon. As a surprise, Wrecker refurbished the gunners nest into Omega's own room. Hunter quickly assured that Omega was a part of the squad.[[16]](#cite_note-Replacements-16)

##### Quick supply run[]

While traveling through space, Hunter proposed that they go to [Idaflor](/wiki/Idaflor "Idaflor"), but Wrecker argued that the planet is not inhabited, which is why Hunter thought it would be a good hiding place. Omega complained that she'd been stuck on Kamino for her whole life, asking if they could do some exploring. Hunter disagreed and said that they needed to lie low. Tech told them that they were running out of [fuel](/wiki/Fuel "Fuel") and rations. Since they were no longer serving the Galactic Republic, they were on their own. Echo also warned that the *Marauder*'s signature is on the wanted list.[[17]](#cite_note-Cornered-17)

Tech proposed to scramble the starship's signature. To do so, he needed to land to perform the calculations. He stated that the nearest world is [Pantora](/wiki/Pantora "Pantora"). Hunter agreed, and the Bad Batch left the ship's deck except for Omega.[[17]](#cite_note-Cornered-17)

 [![The Bad Batch shortly after arriving on Pantora.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/8/8f/BadBatchPantora-Cornered.png/revision/latest?cb=20220119021909) [![The Bad Batch shortly after arriving on Pantora.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/8/8f/BadBatchPantora-Cornered.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/275?cb=20220119021909)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/8/8f/BadBatchPantora-Cornered.png/revision/latest?cb=20220119021909) 

The Bad Batch shortly after arriving on Pantora.

 

The *Marauder* reached Pantora and descend through the clouds toward a large outpost known as [Ro Station](/wiki/Ro_Station "Ro Station") surrounded by valleys. As the Bad Batch descended down the gangplank, Wrecker grumbled about being hungry, but tech reminded him that they are there to change the ship's signature. They were greeted by a [Sullustan](/wiki/Sullustan "Sullustan") who asked if they are in need of reparations. Tech replied that they are only there for minor calibration and fuel. Wrecker was unhappy about selling their armaments, but Hunter, placed one charge in his backpack, said that it's the only thing they own worth any money. Hunter, aware of Omega's curiosity, clarified that this is a supply run and that they have to move in and out quickly and quietly. Without any of their knowledge, they were being watched by the Sullustan spy.[[17]](#cite_note-Cornered-17)

Hunter, Echo, and Omega watched a column of clone troopers marching by while civilians cheer. When Omega asked what the celebration is about, Hunter explained that they are celebrating the end of the Clone Wars. The clones also saw a recording of Imperial Vice Admiral Rampart encouraging the citizens to register for chain codes and to exchange their Republic currency for Imperial credits at no cost, which they recognized from Saleucami. Hunter thought that they should be fast with their supply run to avoid any unwanted attention.[[17]](#cite_note-Cornered-17)

Hunter tried to sell a [pyro denton explosive](/wiki/Pyro_denton_explosive "Pyro denton explosive") for 1,800 credits to a [Gran](/wiki/Gran "Gran") [merchant](/wiki/Merchant "Merchant"). The merchant told Hunter that he should sell it at the [black market](/wiki/Black_market "Black market"). While Omega showed Echo a doll she was looking at, the Gran merchant watched them keenly through his two remaining eyes. Mistaking Echo for a droid, he proposed that Hunter should sell him for 2,000 credits. Echo was not enthusiastic about the plan, but Hunter said that once they get all the supplies, he will give him a signal to leave. Echo complied but convinced Hunter to bid for 4,000 credits. They settled the deal at 3,000 credits. After selling his "droid", Hunter realized that Omega is missing and ran after her.[[17]](#cite_note-Cornered-17)

##### Fugitive of Pantora[]

Hunter quickly found Omega with a [woman](/wiki/Fennec_Shand "Fennec Shand"), which he told Omega to step away from. The woman replied that she and Omega were getting to know each other before donning her helmet. He and the woman stared each other down as he reach for his knife, but she fired first with her blaster pistol. Hunter then threw his knife at her, who blocked it with an object before dodging another attack from him and taking the knife herself, forcing him on the defensive. As the two fight, Hunter told Omega to run. Just then, [Pantoran Security](/wiki/Pantoran_Security "Pantoran Security") officers arrived, prompting Shand to retrieve her pistol and flee.[[17]](#cite_note-Cornered-17)

 [![Hunter fights against a bounty hunter, Fennec Shand.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/b/ba/HunterShandKnifeFight-Cornered.png/revision/latest?cb=20220106050117) [![Hunter fights against a bounty hunter, Fennec Shand.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/b/ba/HunterShandKnifeFight-Cornered.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20220106050117)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/b/ba/HunterShandKnifeFight-Cornered.png/revision/latest?cb=20220106050117) 

Hunter fights against a bounty hunter, Fennec Shand.

 

Hunter contacted Tech, Wrecker, and Echo that he had lost Omega to a highly trained mercenary. Tech decided to tap into the [CCTV system](/wiki/CCTV_system "CCTV system") in order to find Omega and the woman. Hunter quickly warned Tech to get the ship ready. As Hunter looked for her, Tech intercepted com chatter discussing reports of a child hanging from a tower in the lower division. Tech conveyed the news to a shocked Hunter. This attracted the Pantoran security officers to pursuit both Hunter and the mercenary. Hunter then stole a speeder bike. The mercenary spotted Hunter weaving through the skyway traffic to reach them. She told Omega to tuck and roll when she fell onto a [hovertruck](/wiki/Speeder_truck "Speeder truck") below. He flew to the hovertruck and reached out to Omega. However the mercenary rammed into him using a hijacked airspeeder, causing him to swerve away.[[17]](#cite_note-Cornered-17)

Hunter blasted the engine of the hijacked airspeeder, causing it to explode. He caught Omega as she lost her grip. He then warned her that they are not out of trouble yet, he reversed his speeder bike into the hijacked speeder. He planted a detonator, which caused the speeder to explode. Soon after, they managed to arrive back at the hangar. The Sullustan manager ran out, but unable to stop the *Marauder* from escaping.[[17]](#cite_note-Cornered-17)

While in space, Hunter told Omega that their opponent was a bounty hunter but is unaware of the identity. Echo explained that a bounty hunter is someone who hunts targets while Tech added that she is the target. Wrecker thought they should not scare Omega. Hunter said that they need to find out who the bounty hunter was and who hired her. Omega wore a worried expression in response.[[17]](#cite_note-Cornered-17)

#### A new ally[]

 [![Scaleback offers intel about the unidentified bounty hunter in exchange for a mission.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/f/f9/CidHome.png/revision/latest?cb=20220107040000) [![Scaleback offers intel about the unidentified bounty hunter in exchange for a mission.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/f/f9/CidHome.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/275?cb=20220107040000)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/f/f9/CidHome.png/revision/latest?cb=20220107040000) 

Scaleback offers intel about the unidentified bounty hunter in exchange for a mission.

 

Tech was fitting Crosshair's comm device and gave it to Omega while the squad was heading for [Ord Mantell](/wiki/Ord_Mantell "Ord Mantell"). They needed to find out why a bounty hunter was after Omega. Echo knew an informant there named [Ciddarin Scaleback](/wiki/Ciddarin_Scaleback "Ciddarin Scaleback"), a friend of the Jedi. When the squad arrived at the planet's surface, they entered a [parlor](/wiki/Cid%27s_Parlor "Cid's Parlor"). They asked the owner if she knew Scaleback, and she said she didn't know him. Hunter, Tech, Echo, and Wrecker talked about what to do while Omega looked around and found out the owner was Scaleback. Scaleback led the squad inside her office. Hunter showed her a hologram of the female bounty hunter. Scaleback said she didn't know her, but she could find out. Scaleback told them if they did a mission, she would find out who the female bounty hunter was. Hunter agreed. Scaleback told them it was a rescue mission, and they had to rescue a child named [Muchi](/wiki/Muchi "Muchi") from some [Zygerrian](/wiki/Zygerrian "Zygerrian") [enslavers](/wiki/Enslaver "Enslaver"). Scaleback gave them more information on an intel stick.[[18]](#cite_note-Rampage-18)

The squad then headed off for the ruins of [Old Ord Mantell City](/wiki/Old_Ord_Mantell_City "Old Ord Mantell City"). When they arrived, they stood on a cliff using [binoculars](/wiki/Binoculars "Binoculars") to look where the child was. Hunter told Echo to be their eyes in the sky and tasked Wrecker to distract the Zygerrian slave traders. Hunter said that he and Tech will grab the rancor. Echo climbed up to the tower, but a large [brezak](/wiki/Brezak "Brezak") knocked him off. The same brezak used its tail to knock Wrecker off his feet. They quickly got outnumbered and captured in an electric net by the Zygerrians. The Bad Batch was then restrained in electromagnetic restraints. Wrecker managed to loosen his chains only to be shocked by a guard. Next to the clones was a restrained [Falleen](/wiki/Falleen "Falleen") [child](/wiki/Unidentified_Falleen_child "Unidentified Falleen child") who cried after hearing a loud roar from the brezak. Wrecker comforted her by saying that they are the cavalry. Hunter said that they need to signal Omega before she is captured, but unfortunately their gears and weapons were taken away by the Zygerrians.[[18]](#cite_note-Rampage-18)

A few moments later, Tech spotted Omega on top of a building and informed the rest that they don't need a comm to reach her. Omega waved down at them before pointing to a bunch of cables that connected two buildings. The leader of the Zygerrian slavers [Raney](/wiki/Raney "Raney") inspected the captured clones, hoped to sell them for a good price. Echo protested that the Galactic Republic outlawed slavery. Raney countered that they are no longer in the Republic. Noticed what Omega was trying to do, the Bad Batch distracted the Zygerrians slavers. Omega descended down and managed to unlock the cage of an adolescent [rancor](/wiki/Rancor "Rancor") before getting captured by a Zygerrian guard. The Bad Batch took advantage of the chaos caused by the rancor. Omega got out and approached the Falleen child who she believed to be Muchi, she said that they are here to take her home. Her [father](/wiki/Unidentified_Falleen_prisoner "Unidentified Falleen prisoner"), spoke in [Falleen](/wiki/Falleen_(language) "Falleen (language)") quickly pointed out that Muchi was not the Falleen girl, but rather the rampaging adolescent rancor. Hunter told the squad that they need to capture Muchi for the intel provided by Scaleback. Omega noticed the other three slaves and asked about them, Echo replied that he and Omega will get the other slaves to safety while the rest went to look for Muchi.[[18]](#cite_note-Rampage-18)

It didn't take too long for the squad to locate the rancor. They slowly converge on Muchi but Raney descended on the clones with his brezak and scattered them. Muchi tried to charge at the brezak but the brezak whipped the rancor aside with its long tail, causing Muchi to whimper. Raney was about to whip the rancor before Hunter threw him to the ground. Muchi took the opportunity to flee with the brezak in pursuit. Raney confronted Hunter, vowed that he will pay for this. Hunter quickly sent Tech and Wrecker after the rancor. Hunter pulled out his vibro-knife to fight Raney but Raney wrapped around Hunter's right arm with the [electro-whip](/wiki/Electro-whip "Electro-whip"), causing him to drop his knife. However, Hunter managed to push Raney and kicked him to the ground.[[18]](#cite_note-Rampage-18)

 [![The Bad Batch returns Muchi to Bib Fortuna from the Zygerrian slavers.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/e/e5/AHappyReunion-Rampage.png/revision/latest?cb=20220119025350) [![The Bad Batch returns Muchi to Bib Fortuna from the Zygerrian slavers.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/e/e5/AHappyReunion-Rampage.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/275?cb=20220119025350)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/e/e5/AHappyReunion-Rampage.png/revision/latest?cb=20220119025350) 

The Bad Batch returns Muchi to Bib Fortuna from the Zygerrian slavers.

 

Meanwhile, Muchi managed to grab onto the brezak and bite it. The rancor flipped the [reptavian](/wiki/Reptavian "Reptavian") beast up and down then jumped on it. The brezak quickly flew away in defeat. Wrecker tried to show Muchi dominance by force in order to tame her. The rest of the squad caught up to Tech and Wrecker only to see a struggling Wrecker. The squad gathered up closely as they saw Wrecker and Muchi fighting for dominance. Finally, the rancor dropped from exhaustion and Wrecker patted her to sleep. Hunter complimented Wrecker for his accomplishment. They got back to Scaleback's parlor and saw that [Bib Fortuna](/wiki/Bib_Fortuna "Bib Fortuna") was eagerly waiting for Muchi's arrival.[[18]](#cite_note-Rampage-18)

Inside, Scaleback revealed to Hunter the identity of the bounty hunter that he faced on Pantora, Fennec Shand. Scaleback explained that Fennec Shand is new to the scene but had already been proven to be ruthless and cunning. When Hunter asked who hired her, Scaleback said that sources in the Bounty Hunter's guild said that she was working on a direct commission. Scaleback warned Hunter that he will need friends and money, emphasizing the latter. Hunter even admitted that they are not exactly swimming in either. Scaleback then gave Hunter a cut. She told him that more credits are available if he is looking for work. Hunter replied that he will think about it. Scaleback remarked that they must be valuable for a bounty hunter of Shand's caliber to be pursuing them, she added that she is good with keeping secrets.[[18]](#cite_note-Rampage-18)

#### Job on Corellia[]

##### Hunt for the droid head[]

:   "*Tactical droid intel has tremendous value, which is why you're gonna break into the decommissioning facility on Corellia and retrieve one before they're all destroyed.*"  
    "*He haven't decided if we're gonna work for you or not.*"  
    "*Allow me to decide for you, you're in.*"
:   ‚ÄïCiddarin Scaleback and Hunter, discussing if the clones are going to be working for her.[[19]](#cite_note-Decommissioned-19)

 [![Scaleback briefs the Bad Batch about their next mission.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/6/65/CidTacticalDroidBriefing-Decommissioned.png/revision/latest?cb=20220108213452) [![Scaleback briefs the Bad Batch about their next mission.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/6/65/CidTacticalDroidBriefing-Decommissioned.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/280?cb=20220108213452)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/6/65/CidTacticalDroidBriefing-Decommissioned.png/revision/latest?cb=20220108213452) 

Scaleback briefs the Bad Batch about their next mission.

 

While in the parlor, Omega practiced her shooting ability with the [zygerrian energy bow](/wiki/Zygerrian_energy_bow "Zygerrian energy bow"). She retrieved it from a Zygerrian slaver during their previous mission. Regular patrons of the parlor, an [Ithorian](/wiki/Ithorian "Ithorian") [Bolo](/wiki/Bolo "Bolo") and a [Weequay](/wiki/Weequay "Weequay") [Ketch](/wiki/Ketch "Ketch") bet on Omega's shot while watching. Echo helped teach her target practice. Omega told Echo that she had gotten three out of twelve, Echo replied that it was luck rather than skill, he added that soldiers need to be consistent. Wrecker commented to Hunter that Omega is not a natural, while Hunter continued to observe the training. Scaleback appeared announcing that playtime is over and kicked the Ithorian and Weequay out. Scaleback asked the squad if they are familiar with a Separatist tactical droid, Tech interjected that they were the brain of the Separatist military shortly before Scaleback snapped that this was her briefing. She tasked the clones to infiltrate a decommissioning facility on [Corellia](/wiki/Corellia "Corellia") and retrieved a tactical droid intelligence for its tremendous value and before everything got destroyed.[[19]](#cite_note-Decommissioned-19)

After the briefing, Hunter told Scaleback that they hadn't decided on working for her yet, Scaleback proposed a "mutually beneficial arrangement" in which both parties will make money and that Scaleback will also have their back. She said that it's the best option for them given their current situation and heat on them. Hunter reluctantly agreed, Scaleback reiterated that she already told them they're in. She also told Omega that her "weak noodle arm" was the reason for her poor archery skill, she demonstrated by firing three bullseyes in a row before returning the energy bow to Omega.[[19]](#cite_note-Decommissioned-19)

The Bad Batch traveled to Corellia aboard the *Marauder*, while hitching a ride on the underside of a [class four container transport](/wiki/Class_four_container_transport "Class four container transport"). Echo remarked that this is an old trick, but Tech responded that it had gotten them past the planetary sensors every time. Omega asked why a tactical droid is more important than other droids. Echo replied that the more the tactical droid fought, the more they learned and won. The squad disembarked and entered [Coronet City](/wiki/Coronet_City "Coronet City")'s industrial district. They then avoided the patrolling [police droids](/wiki/Imperial_Police_Droid "Imperial Police Droid"). Hunter said Scaleback did not mention the droids. Tech observed that they are operating on a rotating quadrant scan. He added that if they time it correctly, there will be an entry point in their blind spot. Tech led the squad as they entered the decommissioning facility.[[19]](#cite_note-Decommissioned-19)

Inside, there were several workers who were fully covered in masks and suits. While exiting a doorway, Wrecker knocked a worker out and hid him. Hunter told Echo and Tech to locate and retrieve the droid, while Wrecker will cover the squad from above. Wrecker complained that it was Crosshair's job, but Hunter responded that it was not a request. Omega asked about what she should do, but Hunter insisted on her to stay and keep watch. While Hunter was on a lookout, Echo found out that only one tactical droid was listed and that the rest had been destroyed. Hunter added that they only have one shot. Echo said that the droid was offloaded in the north end conveyor.[[19]](#cite_note-Decommissioned-19)

 [![Hunter holding Trace Martez at Gunpoint.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/f/f0/HunterTraceGunpoint.png/revision/latest?cb=20230213102558) [![Hunter holding Trace Martez at Gunpoint.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/f/f0/HunterTraceGunpoint.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20230213102558)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/f/f0/HunterTraceGunpoint.png/revision/latest?cb=20230213102558) 

Hunter holding Trace Martez at Gunpoint.

 

Omega called the squad that she had found the tactical droid on a conveyor belt. She clarified that the droid was already in pieces, but the head was still intact. As she was watching, one of the worker [Trace Martez](/wiki/Trace_Martez "Trace Martez") stole the head of the tactical droid. Omega tried to intervene, but Hunter immediately told her to stay put and disengage. Before Omega could intervene any further, another worker [Rafa Martez](/wiki/Rafa_Martez "Rafa Martez") stopped her. Trace ran into Hunter, Tech, and Echo as she descended down a flight of stairs. They immediately held the worker at gunpoint. Tech asked the worker who she is, then Trace unmasked herself asking the same question. A blaster from Omega's energy bow hit a vent and released a gas and workers started to panic. A worker noticed the clones and reported a security breach that caused the facility to go on a full lockdown. The other workers managed to flee behind a blast door as the alarm rang. They all soon found themselves trapped inside the facility. Police droids started to come in, firing at the clones and the two sisters. Omega continued to pursue Rafa, despite Hunter's order. While the clones were exchanging fire with the police droids, Trace took the opportunity to flee. Hunter tasked the other clones to lift up the lockdown and himself to get the droid head.[[19]](#cite_note-Decommissioned-19)

The chase for the droid head continued as Trace threw the droid to Rafa before Hunter caught her. Rafa bumped a police droid which caused the droid head to fall on a conveyor belt. Omega and Trace raced down the conveyor belt for the head while Hunter shoot down a police droid approaching him and Rafa. Meanwhile, Echo accidentally short-circuited the entire system while trying to lift the lockdown and asked Wrecker to go to the main control panel to reactivate the system. Wrecker managed to reactivate the system which caused the conveyor belt to move and trapped Omega's leg under droid parts. Hunter asked Rafa why she was interested in a tactical droid head, but got no clear answer. Trace snatched the droid head from Omega and ran away. As the conveyor belt moved closer to the smelter, Omega cried for help on comlink. Hunter reassured Omega that he was on his way. Hunter tried to bring down the whole structure of the conveyor belt by connecting it to a support pose with a grappling hook. The conveyor belt was jammed for a bit before taking down a walkway. Omega fell to the second conveyor belt before Hunter could reach her. Trace came back and called out for Omega trying to reach her. Omega used an old B2-series super battle droid's leg as a lever to reach Trace, Hunter then joined in to pull Omega out. Hunter reluctantly thanked Trace.[[19]](#cite_note-Decommissioned-19)

##### Temporary truce[]

:   "*To be honest, things were clearer when we were just soldiers.*"  
    "*Take it from me. In the end, we all choose sides.*"
:   ‚ÄïHunter and Rafa Martez, about the galaxy changing[[19]](#cite_note-Decommissioned-19)

 [![Hunter and Rafa form a temporary truce.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/7/74/HunterRafa-Decommissioned.png/revision/latest?cb=20220108200250) [![Hunter and Rafa form a temporary truce.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/7/74/HunterRafa-Decommissioned.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20220108200250)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/7/74/HunterRafa-Decommissioned.png/revision/latest?cb=20220108200250) 

Hunter and Rafa form a temporary truce.

 

Before arguing any further about the droid head, Hunter suggested a truce between the clones and the sisters to get out. Trace said that she needed a diversion. She tinkered with the tactical droid's head to reactivate battle droids. Hunter warned her that reactivating clankers are dangerous, Trace replied that it's not if they are controlling them. However, the tactical droid's signal was too weak to transmit, Tech helped her to boost the signal and started to reprogram the droid. As the police droids converged on them, Wrecker jumped down and took out several police droids. Tech finished the reprogram and Trace commanded the battle droid to attack the police droids. Soon after, battle droids started to converge and attacked the police droids. The clones and the sisters took the opportunity to leave the facility. Trace radioed [R7-A7](/wiki/R7-A7 "R7-A7") for a pick up. They ran into more police droids. Trace accidentally dropped the droid head, destroying it. As more police droids and battle droids exchanged fire, they all fled aboard the sisters' [ship](/wiki/Silver_Angel "Silver Angel").[[19]](#cite_note-Decommissioned-19)

 [![Hunter gives Rafa a data rod containing the intelligence of a tactical droid.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/8/88/HunterRafaDatarod-Decommissioned.png/revision/latest?cb=20220108184915) [![Hunter gives Rafa a data rod containing the intelligence of a tactical droid.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/8/88/HunterRafaDatarod-Decommissioned.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20220108184915)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/8/88/HunterRafaDatarod-Decommissioned.png/revision/latest?cb=20220108184915) 

Hunter gives Rafa a data rod containing the intelligence of a tactical droid.

 

Aboard the ship, both parties were not happy that the tactical droid head was destroyed. Rafa asked if the clones did not know who the were giving the information to, Hunter replied that they were paid to acquire and deliver, not to asked questions. Trace said that their contact needed it to fight against the Empire. Rafa asked why the clones were not fighting for the Empire. Hunter said that not all clones are the same and that they are different, but Rafa doubted by saying that she had heard that before. Later the sisters dropped the clones near the *Marauder*. Omega invited the sisters to visit them in Ord Mantell. Rafa encouraged Omega to continue practice with the energy bow. After Omega went to the *Marauder*, Hunter gave Rafa a [data rod](/wiki/Data_rod "Data rod") that contained the intelligence from the tactical droid before it was destroyed. Rafa remarked that the clones are different, Hunter replied that things were clearer during the Clone Wars. Rafa advised that in the end they all take sides. The clones and the sisters departed in their separate ways.[[19]](#cite_note-Decommissioned-19)

#### Reunion on Bracca[]

##### Ruby heist[]

:   "*As long as you get paid.*"
:   ‚ÄïHunter, on doing jobs for Scaleback[[20]](#cite_note-Battle_Scars-20)

Sometime later while on a job, the *Marauder* was pursued by three [Rhokai gang](/wiki/Rhokai_gang_starfighter "Rhokai gang starfighter") [starfighters](/wiki/Starfighter "Starfighter"). Hunter asked how long before they could jump into hyperspace, as he manned the rear gun. Tech said that depended on how long for Echo to get the hyperdrive back online. Echo responded that he is working on it. Omega, strapped in next to a cage which was somewhat secured, said she thought that [Ruby](/wiki/Ruby_(lizard) "Ruby (lizard)") was getting scared, which prompted Wrecker to express surprise that she named the [lizard](/wiki/Zardimallo "Zardimallo").[[20]](#cite_note-Battle_Scars-20)

As the pursuit continued, Wrecker asked what was up with their pursuers. Omega pointed out that they did steal from them. Tech responded that the [Rhokai](/wiki/Rhokai_gang "Rhokai gang") stole the lizard and that they were merely "intercepting" it. Hunter countered that the Rhokai didn't see it that way. Due to the chaos and movement, the cage fell and the frightened lizard fled. Ruby jumped onto Wrecker, which prompted him to start panicking too. Omega told Wrecker to stay calm as he was scaring the lizard. Finally, Echo managed to get the hyperdrive back online as Omega secured Ruby back in her the the cage. Tech pulled the lever and the *Marauder* jumped into Hyperspace.[[20]](#cite_note-Battle_Scars-20)

 [![The Bad Batch receives payments from Scaleback.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/5/53/HunterEchoTechCidOfficeDebt.png/revision/latest?cb=20230215172256) [![The Bad Batch receives payments from Scaleback.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/5/53/HunterEchoTechCidOfficeDebt.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20230215172256)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/5/53/HunterEchoTechCidOfficeDebt.png/revision/latest?cb=20230215172256) 

The Bad Batch receives payments from Scaleback.

 

Back on Ord Mantell, the Bad Batch showed Ruby to Scaleback. She remarked that the lizard is "strange-looking". Echo asked Scaleback what the client wanted to do with the lizard. She guessed that he might want it as a pet or for a [stew](/wiki/Stew "Stew"), but she added that she didn't care. Hunter remarked as long as Scaleback got paid, she agreed that he started to catch on. Scaleback led them back to her office. As they went to the back, Hunter noticed a hooded figure amongst other patrons in the parlor. Omega and Wrecker sought Hunter's permission to go outside and celebrate after the mission ended to make the former happy. Hunter agreed, but told them to not stay away for too long. Back at Scaleback's office, the Trandoshan gave them a third of the credits that were promised. Hunter and Echo quickly protested, but she replied that she was also promised three times the rate. When Echo asked how this arrangement was mutually beneficial to them, with she responded that she was being generous in light of the debt they owed her.[[20]](#cite_note-Battle_Scars-20)

Hunter questioned what debt she spoke about, leading to Scaleback showing him a datapad of docking fees, port charges, gear, fuel, rations, and 20 cartons of [Mantell Mix](/wiki/Mantell_Mix "Mantell Mix"). She told the clones that she liked them but that she was not running a charity. They would need a big score to get even. When Echo asked for clarification, Scaleback replied that the tactical droid would have made a lot of money but they [bungled it up](/wiki/Mission_to_a_droid_decommissioning_facility "Mission to a droid decommissioning facility"). Scaleback warned them to figure something out before they saw her ugly side. Tech made a quip about her appearance. Scaleback was about to respond, but they heard a blaster-fire inside the bar.[[20]](#cite_note-Battle_Scars-20)

##### An old friend[]

:   "*What's in your head is more dangerous than you can imagine.*"
:   ‚ÄïRex, about the capability of the inhibitor chips[[20]](#cite_note-Battle_Scars-20)

 [![Rex meets the squad again on Ord Mantell.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/c/c9/RexMeetsTBBAgain.png/revision/latest?cb=20230216144502) [![Rex meets the squad again on Ord Mantell.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/c/c9/RexMeetsTBBAgain.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20230216144502)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/c/c9/RexMeetsTBBAgain.png/revision/latest?cb=20230216144502) 

Rex meets the squad again on Ord Mantell.

 

The clones and Scaleback quickly went outside to investigate the noise. They saw Bolo and Ketch fleeing upstairs. Scaleback asked the hooded figure who he was, and the hooded figure revealed himself as the former Clone Captain Rex. Scaleback grumbled about hosting another clone and warned the Bad Batch that she was done taking in strays. As Hunter approached Rex, Echo asked the Captain where he had been. Rex replied that it was a long story. Later, Rex explained that he had been keeping a low profile since the end of the Clone Wars. Tech agreed, saying Imperial files listed Rex as being killed in action. Rex replied that being dead in the Empire's eyes has its advantages. Echo asked him how he tracked them down. Rex told them that Trace and Rafa informed him about a team of rogue clones who helped them on Corellia. He added that the sisters also told him about the clones traveling with a kid. Rex asked who she was. Hunter explained that Omega is also a clone just like the rest of them. As they were talking, Wrecker and Omega returned. Wrecker recognized Rex, which prompted him to give the Captain a bear hug. Hunter introduced Rex to Omega. Rex knelt to talk to Omega, he told her that he has met many clones but never like her. Omega stepped forward and deduced that Rex is a Generation One clone trooper based on the wrinkle lines on his face. Amused, Rex made a quip that he has been around.[[20]](#cite_note-Battle_Scars-20)

Wrecker grimaced and touched his head, asking Tech for another [med patch](/wiki/Med_patch "Med patch"). Tech reminded Wrecker that he used the last one. Rex asked them what happened, Wrecker responded that it was just [headache](/wiki/Headache "Headache"). As Echo noted that the headache were becoming more frequent, Rex took an interest. Tech told Rex that their deviant nature appeared to have impeded the functionality of their inhibitor chip, with the exception of Crosshair. Alarmed, Rex asked the squad if they hadn't removed their chips.[[20]](#cite_note-Battle_Scars-20)

As Tech confirmed, Rex slowly reached for his blaster. He said that the chips made them a threat to everyone, Omega included. As the room became more tense, Rex described the chips as ticking time bombs, Hunter told him to calm down. Having experienced Order 66, Rex warned them that the chips are dangerous. Rex was unwilling to bury more of his brothers because of it. He said that the chips are something they can't control, just like he can't. Omega looked at Hunter, who frowned. Hunter agreed and asked the Captain how they should take out their chips. Relaxed, Rex let go of his blaster, he said that he will be in touch.[[20]](#cite_note-Battle_Scars-20)

##### Rendezvous on Bracca[]

:   "*Do we really have to do this?*"  
    "*If Rex is sure, we should trust him.*"
:   ‚ÄïWrecker and Hunter, about Rex and his knowledge of the inhibitor chips[[20]](#cite_note-Battle_Scars-20)

Later, the *Marauder* traveled through the hyperspace. While Wrecker clutched his head in pain, Omega assisted Tech with some tools as he work on the [chip scanner](/wiki/Chip_scanner "Chip scanner"). Wrecker was uneasy about the plan, but Hunter reminded him that they agreed to meet Rex on [Bracca](/wiki/Bracca "Bracca"). As Wrecker grumbled, Hunter asked Tech about the progress of the scanner, to which he replied that he was able to establish a baseline from Rex's brain scan to theirs; taking into account of any cellular anomalies. Wrecker was still unsure about the procedure, but Hunter assured him that they should trust Rex.[[20]](#cite_note-Battle_Scars-20)

 [![Rex leads Hunter and the rest of the squad through the wreckage on Bracca.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/3/32/Bad_Batch_and_Rex_on_Bracca.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20230410091054) [![Rex leads Hunter and the rest of the squad through the wreckage on Bracca.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/3/32/Bad_Batch_and_Rex_on_Bracca.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20230410091054)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/3/32/Bad_Batch_and_Rex_on_Bracca.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20230410091054) 

Rex leads Hunter and the rest of the squad through the wreckage on Bracca.

 

The *Marauder* soon descended into Bracca. Echo picked up Rex's beacon as they flew over a massive starship [salvage yard](/wiki/Salvage_yard "Salvage yard"). They landed on a scrappy [hangar](/wiki/Hangar "Hangar") and saw a parked [Y-wing starfighter](/wiki/BTL-B_Y-wing_starfighter/bomber "BTL-B Y-wing starfighter/bomber"), Rex waited and greeted Hunter and the other clones as they arrived. Rex led the clones to a wrecked *Venator*-class Star Destroyer and told them that he removed his chip in a similar [cruiser](/wiki/Cruiser "Cruiser"). Curiously, Wrecker asked why they landed far away from the actual destination, before anyone could reply Hunter spotted a [hover barge](/wiki/Hover_barge "Hover barge") and took cover to hide. Tech identified the craft and said that it belonged to the [Scrapper Guild](/wiki/Scrapper_Guild "Scrapper Guild"). Rex explained that the guild controlled the planet and the importance to stay hidden from them, finally answering Wrecker's question. The clones then headed deeper into the wreckage of the capital ship.[[20]](#cite_note-Battle_Scars-20)

##### Deep in the wreckage[]

As the clones walked through the wreckage, Rex told Echo about [Fives](/wiki/Fives "Fives") and his [warning](/wiki/Mission_to_Level_1325 "Mission to Level 1325") about the chip during the Clone Wars. Rex asked how the the Bad Batch knew about the existence of the chips in their head, Echo replied that Omega told them about the chips which surprised Rex. As they traversed further, Hunter sensed a movement coming from an area submerged with water and warned Tech to stay above the waterline. They entered the ship's corridor, Rex then told the clones that he had [help](/wiki/Ahsoka_Tano "Ahsoka Tano") with the removal of his chip.[[20]](#cite_note-Battle_Scars-20)

Later, They were stopped by a large gap leading all the way down to the water below. The [medical bay](/wiki/Medical_bay "Medical bay") being on the opposite end of the gap, Rex improvised and used a cable to cross over the steep gap. The clones slowly and steadily crossed to the other end of the corridor, except for Wrecker. Due to his fear of heights, Wrecker was reluctant but eventually decided to cross over as well.[[20]](#cite_note-Battle_Scars-20)

After reaching the medical bay, Wrecker's inhibitor chip activated, leading him to strangle Tech and try to hunt down Omega. Hunter aided the others in capturing Wrecker and removing his inhibitor chip. After waking up, Wrecker apologized to his squad.[[20]](#cite_note-Battle_Scars-20)

## Personality and traits[]

:   "*All right, what are your orders? We pick them off from the treeline one by one?*"  
    "*Actually, I was thinking we'd take a page from your book. Rush them head on.*"  
    "*I like your style.*"
:   ‚ÄïHunter and Rex during the Battle of Anaxes¬†‚Äî ![20?cb=20250116042720](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/e/ee/Quote-audio.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/20?cb=20250116042720) [Link](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/5/53/ILikeYourStyle-TBB.flac/revision/latest?cb=20250327205817)‚ñ∂Ô∏è ([file info](/wiki/File:ILikeYourStyle-TBB.flac "File:ILikeYourStyle-TBB.flac"))[[2]](#cite_note-The_Bad_Batch-2)

 [![Hunter was a skilled fighter](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/4/41/The-bad-batch-season-2-character-posters-hunter.png/revision/latest?cb=20230417134021) [![Hunter was a skilled fighter](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/4/41/The-bad-batch-season-2-character-posters-hunter.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/200?cb=20230417134021)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/4/41/The-bad-batch-season-2-character-posters-hunter.png/revision/latest?cb=20230417134021) 

Hunter was a skilled fighter

 

Hunter was the nickname of a clone commando whose serial number remained a secret, not being told to others.[[21]](#cite_note-Clone_Tales-21) A little gruff, but not unfriendly, Hunter habitually expressed himself in straight words,[[2]](#cite_note-The_Bad_Batch-2) although, at times, he did show a sense of humor.[[14]](#cite_note-On_the_Wings_of_Keeradaks-14) Hunter was described as strong and stoic.[[3]](#cite_note-HunterDB-3) Hunter's appearance, unlike that of other members of Clone Force 99, closely resembled that of regular clone troopers and of his progenitor [Jango Fett](/wiki/Jango_Fett "Jango Fett").[[22]](#cite_note-Cosplay-22) Other clone troopers, such as Jesse, could not identify his distinctions from a regular clone trooper by comparison to the rest of Clone Force 99.[[2]](#cite_note-The_Bad_Batch-2)

The entire left side of Hunter's face was tattooed with half of a skull. He had longish [dark brown](/wiki/Color "Color") [hair](/wiki/Hair "Hair")[[2]](#cite_note-The_Bad_Batch-2) that later started to gray,[[4]](#cite_note-Cavalry-4) and he wore a red bandana at most times with a small white skull symbol.[[2]](#cite_note-The_Bad_Batch-2) He was 1.8 [meters](/wiki/Meter "Meter") (5 [feet](/wiki/Foot "Foot"), 11 inches) tall,[[1]](#cite_note-CWCE_JtB-1) with brown [eyes](/wiki/Eye "Eye") and tan skin.[[2]](#cite_note-The_Bad_Batch-2) During the battle of Anaxes, Hunter played a role as a mediator between the regular clones, such as Jesse and Rex, and the members of Clone Force 99. The sergeant had to deescalate rising tensions that resulted in physical actions, reminding the clones that they were on the same side.[[2]](#cite_note-The_Bad_Batch-2)[[14]](#cite_note-On_the_Wings_of_Keeradaks-14) Indeed, for all of his and his squad's talk about "regs,"[[2]](#cite_note-The_Bad_Batch-2) Hunter did demonstrate a care for his fellow clone troopers. During the Imperial Era, upon learning that [Sohi](/wiki/Sohi "Sohi") was a former member of the Confederacy of Independent Systems who had helped leak clone troop movements, Hunter was enraged to have a "clone killer" on the *Marauder* and approached her in a fury, only being held back by Wrecker, to demand she leave their ship.[[23]](#cite_note-Sanctuary-23)

When Order 66 was initiated, Hunter was reluctant to follow it, and tried to keep the young Padawan Caleb Dume safe from the other clones. He was initially annoyed by the young enhanced clone Omega, warning her to stay away from them since the squad was "nothing but trouble." However, Hunter took a liking to her and insisted on returning to Kamino to retrieve her even though it placed his squad at great risk, saying she was one of them.[[5]](#cite_note-Aftermath-5) Hunter would then develop a strong bond with Omega, becoming very protective and acting as a parental guardian towards her.[[24]](#cite_note-Reunion-24)

Hunter demonstrated a strong sense of morality and knowledge of right and wrong, to the point of disobeying orders he felt were unjust. When Crosshair, one of Clone Force 99's members, turned on his own team and berated them for letting Caleb Dume live, Hunter responded without hesitation that he did what he felt was right. Similarly, he refused to eliminate the "insurgents" that Tarkin sent them to eliminate on Onderon, because they were civilians and refugees, not soldiers.[[5]](#cite_note-Aftermath-5) While he had been willing to overlook the war's politics during his mission to Raxus,[[25]](#cite_note-Common_Ground-25) Hunter was none-too-pleased to be sharing a space aboard the *Marauder* with someone who had hypothetically fought clones upon learning of Sohi's loyalties. Learning of her role in killing his brethren threw him into a rage that he was only able to calm by kicking and throwing [Ponder](/wiki/Ponder "Ponder"), whom he regarded as a traitor to their kind for protecting a "clone killer."[[23]](#cite_note-Sanctuary-23)

## Skills and abilities[]

:   "*Well, maps can be wrong. Hunter never is.*"
:   ‚ÄïTech[[2]](#cite_note-The_Bad_Batch-2)

Hunter's mutations granted him enhanced senses that allowed him to perceive electromagnetic frequencies, which meant while maps of enemy-controlled regions may be wrong, he rarely was. His mutation was especially useful during the Clone Wars to track droids' electromagnetic fields. Hunter had specialist training and was a superior [hand-to-hand combatant](/wiki/Unarmed_combat "Unarmed combat").[[1]](#cite_note-CWCE_JtB-1) He was an agile fighter, able to perform flips and kicks while coordinating his blaster-fire and strikes with his weapons. He was also skilled as a leader.[[2]](#cite_note-The_Bad_Batch-2) Hunter was incredibly skilled with a number of weapons, but his favorite was his [vibro-knife](/wiki/Vibroknife "Vibroknife").[[26]](#cite_note-audio_description-26)

## Equipment[]

 [![Hunter's armor and vibro-knife](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/8/81/Hunter_AG.png/revision/latest?cb=20200406133934) [![Hunter's armor and vibro-knife](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/8/81/Hunter_AG.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/140?cb=20200406133934)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/8/81/Hunter_AG.png/revision/latest?cb=20200406133934) 

Hunter's armor and vibro-knife

 

In combat, Hunter regularly utilized a [DC-17 hand blaster](/wiki/DC-17_repeater_hand_blaster "DC-17 repeater hand blaster"),[[2]](#cite_note-The_Bad_Batch-2) a [DC-17m Interchangeable Weapon System](/wiki/DC-17m_Interchangeable_Weapon_System "DC-17m Interchangeable Weapon System"),[[9]](#cite_note-A_Distant_Echo-9) a vibro-knife,[[26]](#cite_note-audio_description-26) and during a [mission](/wiki/Mission_to_a_droid_decommissioning_facility "Mission to a droid decommissioning facility") in [Corellia](/wiki/Corellia "Corellia") he carried another [DC-17 hand blaster](/wiki/DC-17_repeater_hand_blaster "DC-17 repeater hand blaster"). He also demonstrated familiarity with weapons employed by enemy combatants, in particular, the [E-5 blaster rifle](/wiki/E-5_blaster_rifle "E-5 blaster rifle") and the [DC-15a blaster carbine](/wiki/DC-15A_blaster_carbine "DC-15A blaster carbine"). Although combat-proficient with [blasters](/wiki/Blaster "Blaster"), the sergeant preferred to engage opponents with his knife at close quarters. As an experimental [clone commando](/wiki/Clone_commando "Clone commando"), he wore a set of modified [*Katarn*-class Commando Armor](/wiki/Katarn-class_commando_armor "Katarn-class commando armor").[[2]](#cite_note-The_Bad_Batch-2) Hunter also had a [Hush-98 comlink](/wiki/Hush-98_comlink "Hush-98 comlink") and wore a [green](/wiki/Color "Color") [tunic](/wiki/Clothing "Clothing") to blend himself amongst civilians.[[17]](#cite_note-Cornered-17)

A few months following the [bombardment](/wiki/Attack_on_Kamino "Attack on Kamino") on Kamino, Hunter alongside the rest of the squad had a new paint job for their armors. Hunter had a lot more color variety on his armor with stripes of orange and blue, further disassociating his past life as a soldier.[[27]](#cite_note-Spoils_of_War-27)

## Behind the scenes[]

 [![Concept design of Hunter](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/0/0a/Hunter_Bad_Batch.png/revision/latest?cb=20150430003902) [![Concept design of Hunter](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/0/0a/Hunter_Bad_Batch.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/205?cb=20150430003902)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/0/0a/Hunter_Bad_Batch.png/revision/latest?cb=20150430003902) 

Concept design of Hunter

 

[George Lucas](/wiki/George_Lucas "George Lucas") envisioned the Bad Batch as a version of [*The Dirty Dozen*](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Dirty_Dozen "wikipedia:The Dirty Dozen") with clones. [Dave Filoni](/wiki/Dave_Filoni "Dave Filoni") sketched their appearances, which [Brent Friedman](/wiki/Brent_Friedman "Brent Friedman") and [Matt Michnovetz](/wiki/Matt_Michnovetz "Matt Michnovetz") used to imagine the Bad Batch's voices and personalities. Matt and Brent worked with Dave to flesh out the characters and their story, where Hunter was inspired by the character of [Billy Sole](https://avp.fandom.com/wiki/Billy_Sole "w:c:avp:Billy Sole") from the [1987](/wiki/1987 "1987") film *[Predator](https://avp.fandom.com/wiki/Predator_(film) "w:c:avp:Predator (film)")*.[[28]](#cite_note-Bad_Batch_Panel-28)

[Clone Force 99](/wiki/Clone_Force_99 "Clone Force 99") was supposed to be introduced in a four-episode arc of *[Star Wars: The Clone Wars](/wiki/Star_Wars:_The_Clone_Wars "Star Wars: The Clone Wars")* season seven before it got cancelled. The story reel was initially released during [Celebration Anaheim](/wiki/Celebration_Anaheim "Celebration Anaheim"), and later on [StarWars.com](/wiki/StarWars.com "StarWars.com") for everyone to see. The arc would later be finished for the [final season](/wiki/The_Clone_Wars:_Season_Seven "The Clone Wars: Season Seven") of *Star Wars: The Clone Wars*.

 [![Hunter, preparing to engage the beasts with Echo in the unfinished episodes on Kashyyyk](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/7/76/Hunter_on_kashyyyk.png/revision/latest?cb=20170608192647) [![Hunter, preparing to engage the beasts with Echo in the unfinished episodes on Kashyyyk](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/7/76/Hunter_on_kashyyyk.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20170608192647)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/7/76/Hunter_on_kashyyyk.png/revision/latest?cb=20170608192647) 

Hunter, preparing to engage the beasts with Echo in the unfinished episodes on Kashyyyk

 

Hunter was to appear in a four-episode arc written by Michnovetz[[29]](#cite_note-BFriedman_Yoda_Kashyyyk_tweet-29) which starred the Bad Batch which now included "Echo", alongside [Yoda](/wiki/Yoda "Yoda") on [Kashyyyk](/wiki/Kashyyyk "Kashyyyk"). At the "Untold Clone Wars" panel at [Celebration Anaheim](/wiki/Celebration_Anaheim_(2015) "Celebration Anaheim (2015)"), Dave Filoni talked about the plot of the arc. He revealed that the characters would ride on "giant ape lizards" that were holy to the [Wookiees](/wiki/Wookiee "Wookiee"). In one scene [Tarfful](/wiki/Tarfful "Tarfful") would ask the tree spirits for permission to go into battle against the enemy, which was a [Trandoshan](/wiki/Trandoshan "Trandoshan") and the Separatist Alliance. To get the enemy out of some of their cities they would have to burn some of the trees. The clones had no problem with it, but it was upsetting to the Wookiees. A part of the arc would be about the clones and the Wookiees finding a common ground to fight the Separatists. A story-reel clip was shown at the panel, which showed the Bad Batch and other Wookiees riding on the "ape lizards" called [mylayas](/wiki/Mylaya "Mylaya") and battling a new creature called [netcasters](/wiki/Kinrath "Kinrath")[[30]](#cite_note-Tribe-30) that was originally based on [kinraths](/wiki/Kinrath/Legends "Kinrath/Legends") from the *[Star Wars: Knights of the Old Republic](/wiki/Star_Wars:_Knights_of_the_Old_Republic "Star Wars: Knights of the Old Republic")* game.[[31]](#cite_note-Untold_Clone_Wars_Panel-31)[[32]](#cite_note-Trivia_Gallery-32)

A few elements from the unfinished arc would later be reworked and appeared in "[Tribe](/wiki/Tribe "Tribe")", the sixth episode of *[Star Wars: The Bad Batch](/wiki/Star_Wars:_The_Bad_Batch "Star Wars: The Bad Batch")*'s [second season](/wiki/The_Bad_Batch_Season_2 "The Bad Batch Season 2"). One example of the rework was the complete behavioral change for the netcasters. The creature seemed intelligent and neutral, unless provoked.[[30]](#cite_note-Tribe-30)

In The Light Side comic strip of [*Star Wars Insider* 222](/wiki/Star_Wars_Insider_222 "Star Wars Insider 222"), a human attended the [Lothal County Fair](/wiki/Lothal_County_Fair "Lothal County Fair") and got their face painted like Hunter's by [Sabine Wren](/wiki/Sabine_Wren "Sabine Wren"). The individual was on their phone as [C1-10P](/wiki/C1-10P "C1-10P"), painted to look like [Darth Maul](/wiki/Maul "Maul"), chased someone dressed as Obi-Wan Kenobi.[[33]](#cite_note-222_Launchpad-33)

[‚Üë](#cite_ref-Hylanth_Date_12-0) According to *[Star Wars: The Clone Wars: Character Encyclopedia - Join the Battle!](/wiki/Star_Wars:_The_Clone_Wars:_Character_Encyclopedia_-_Join_the_Battle! "Star Wars: The Clone Wars: Character Encyclopedia - Join the Battle!")*, the name "[Clone Force 99](/wiki/Clone_Force_99 "Clone Force 99")" came in honor of the [deceased](/wiki/Death "Death") [Clone 99](/wiki/Clone_99 "Clone 99"), who died during the [Battle of Kamino](/wiki/Battle_of_Kamino "Battle of Kamino") in [21 BBY](/wiki/21_BBY "21 BBY") per *[Star Wars: Timelines](/wiki/Star_Wars:_Timelines "Star Wars: Timelines")*. As the name "Clone Force 99" is used in [*Hyperspace Stories* 10](/wiki/Hyperspace_Stories_10 "Hyperspace Stories 10"), the issue must take place after the Battle of Kamino. The story is also set during the [Clone Wars](/wiki/Clone_Wars "Clone Wars"), which ends in [19 BBY](/wiki/19_BBY "19 BBY") according to *Timelines*. As such, *Hyperspace Stories* 10 must be set between 21 [BBY](/wiki/%27ABY-BBY%27_dating_system "'ABY-BBY' dating system") and 19 BBY. 13. ***LEGO Star Wars: Rebuild the Galaxy - Pieces of the Past*** is an animated series and a sequel to *[LEGO Star Wars: Rebuild the Galaxy](/wiki/LEGO_Star_Wars:_Rebuild_the_Galaxy "LEGO Star Wars: Rebuild the Galaxy")*. It was announced at [*Star Wars* Celebration Japan](/wiki/Celebration_Japan_(2025) "Celebration Japan (2025)") and premiered on [September 19](/wiki/September_19 "September 19"), [2025](/wiki/2025 "2025") on [Disney+](/wiki/Disney%2B "Disney+").[[1]](#cite_note-Announcement-1) A [soundtrack](/wiki/LEGO_Star_Wars:_Rebuild_the_Galaxy_-_Pieces_of_the_Past_(Original_Soundtrack) "LEGO Star Wars: Rebuild the Galaxy - Pieces of the Past (Original Soundtrack)") for the series was released concurrently.[[4]](#cite_note-qobuz-4)

## Production[]

### Development[]

*Rebuild the Galaxy: Pieces of the Past* was written by [Dan Hernandez](/wiki/Dan_Hernandez "Dan Hernandez") and [Benji Samit](/wiki/Benji_Samit "Benji Samit"), who served as the series' showrunners as the sequel series to the [2024](/wiki/2024 "2024") animated series *[LEGO Star Wars: Rebuild the Galaxy](/wiki/LEGO_Star_Wars:_Rebuild_the_Galaxy "LEGO Star Wars: Rebuild the Galaxy")*.[[1]](#cite_note-Announcement-1)[[5]](#cite_note-Giant_Chewbacca-5) The series was directed by [Chris Buckley](/wiki/Chris_Buckley "Chris Buckley").[[5]](#cite_note-Giant_Chewbacca-5)

During a [Celebration Japan](/wiki/Celebration_Japan_(2025) "Celebration Japan (2025)") panel on [April 19](/wiki/April_19 "April 19"), [2025](/wiki/2025 "2025"), [Ahmed Best](/wiki/Ahmed_Best "Ahmed Best") said that the second series would explore the [Darth Jar Jar](/wiki/Jar_Jar_Binks "Jar Jar Binks") theory.[[1]](#cite_note-Announcement-1)

### Casting[]

On April 19, 2025, Best confirmed that he would be reprising his role as "Darth Jar Jar" in *Pieces of the Past*. The characters [Sig Greebling](/wiki/Sig_Greebling "Sig Greebling"), [Yesi Scala](/wiki/Yesi_Scala "Yesi Scala") and [Bobarian Afol](/wiki/Bobarian_Afol "Bobarian Afol") were also confirmed as returning for the second season. In addition, Best confirmed that [Ben Schwartz](/wiki/Ben_Schwartz "Ben Schwartz") would be voicing the [Lepi](/wiki/Lepi "Lepi") smuggler [Jaxxon T. Tumperakki](/wiki/Jaxxon_T._Tumperakki "Jaxxon T. Tumperakki") and that [Ashley Eckstein](/wiki/Ashley_Eckstein "Ashley Eckstein") would be voicing [Ahsoka Tano](/wiki/Ahsoka_Tano "Ahsoka Tano").[[1]](#cite_note-Announcement-1)

On August 14, 2025, [StarWars.com](/wiki/StarWars.com "StarWars.com") confirmed that [Anthony Daniels](/wiki/Anthony_Daniels "Anthony Daniels") would be reprising his role as [C-3PO](/wiki/C-3PO "C-3PO") and [Kelly Marie Tran](/wiki/Kelly_Marie_Tran "Kelly Marie Tran") as Darth [Rose Tico](/wiki/Rose_Tico "Rose Tico"). Other confirmed cast members included [Sam Witwer](/wiki/Sam_Witwer "Sam Witwer") as [Maul](/wiki/Maul "Maul"), [Cameron Monaghan](/wiki/Cameron_Monaghan "Cameron Monaghan") as [Cal Kestis](/wiki/Cal_Kestis "Cal Kestis"), [Nika Futterman](/wiki/Nika_Futterman "Nika Futterman") as [Asajj Ventress](/wiki/Asajj_Ventress "Asajj Ventress") and [James Arnold Taylor](/wiki/James_Arnold_Taylor "James Arnold Taylor") as [Obi-Wan Kenobi](/wiki/Obi-Wan_Kenobi "Obi-Wan Kenobi").[[5]](#cite_note-Giant_Chewbacca-5)

## Release and reception[]

The official trailer was released on [August 14](/wiki/August_14 "August 14"), 2025.[[6]](#cite_note-Official_Trailer-6)[[5]](#cite_note-Giant_Chewbacca-5) On [September 4](/wiki/September_4 "September 4"), a second trailer featuring [Revan](/wiki/Revan "Revan") and [Obi-Wan Kenobi](/wiki/Obi-Wan_Kenobi "Obi-Wan Kenobi") was released.[[7]](#cite_note-Darth_Revan-7)

The series premiered on Disney+ on September 19, 2025.[[1]](#cite_note-Announcement-1)

Wookieepedia Celebrates 20 Years!

 [![Wook-20th-logo](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](/wiki/Wookieepedia "Wookieepedia") [![Wook-20th-logo](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/9/95/Wook-20th-logo.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/270?cb=20250305061023)](/wiki/Wookieepedia "Wookieepedia") 



 

**March 4, starwars.fandom.com**‚ÄîTwenty years ago, *Star Wars* fans were eagerly awaiting the [*REVENGE OF THE SITH*](/wiki/Star_Wars:_Episode_III_Revenge_of_the_Sith "Star Wars: Episode III Revenge of the Sith"), exploring the depths of [Nar Shaddaa](/wiki/Nar_Shaddaa/Legends "Nar Shaddaa/Legends") in the [*KNIGHTS OF THE OLD REPUBLIC II*](/wiki/Star_Wars:_Knights_of_the_Old_Republic_II:_The_Sith_Lords "Star Wars: Knights of the Old Republic II: The Sith Lords"), and beginning to build [WOOKIEEPEDIA](/wiki/Wookieepedia "Wookieepedia")‚Äîthe *Star Wars* wiki. As an ever-growing community of volunteers, the Wookieepedia project now celebrates its 20th year.

Our encyclopedia officially reached **200,000 articles** in February, 2025. This was only possible with the work of hundreds upon hundreds of fans over the past twenty years. Most Wookieepedians started off editing with little to no writing or coding experience, but our efforts have brought us closer to the goal of creating the most accurate, comprehensive, and well-presented resource about all things *Star Wars*.

Since Wookieepedia's [tenth anniversary](/wiki/Wookieepedia:Tenth_Anniversary_Timeline "Wookieepedia:Tenth Anniversary Timeline") in 2015, we have expanded the **breadth, depth, and quality** of our documentation of both the [*Star Wars* Legends](/wiki/Star_Wars_Legends "Star Wars Legends") and the new [canon](/wiki/Canon "Canon") continuities, as well as coverage of *Star Wars* media and production behind the scenes. Wookieepedia has also been building **a more friendly and welcoming community**. Informed by our contributors' experiences, we have launched ongoing efforts in revamping our [policies](/wiki/Wookieepedia:About "Wookieepedia:About") to be clearer and more fair, improving accessibility, and developing new [editing tutorials](/wiki/Wookieepedia:Editing_tutorial:_Padawan "Wookieepedia:Editing tutorial: Padawan").

Since 2015, editor recruitment has advanced on Wookieepedia, with the great majority of the current [administrators](/wiki/Wookieepedia:Administrators "Wookieepedia:Administrators") and [review board members](/wiki/Wookieepedia:EduCorps "Wookieepedia:EduCorps") having joined those groups in recent years. The past ten years has also seen the progress of the [Discussions forum](/wiki/Wookieepedia:Discussions "Wookieepedia:Discussions") and the launch of twenty-two new collaborative [WookieeProjects](/wiki/Wookieepedia:WookieeProjects "Wookieepedia:WookieeProjects"). These include the [Project Stardust](/wiki/Wookieepedia:Project_Stardust "Wookieepedia:Project Stardust") initiative focusing on essential topics and [Project Pride's](/wiki/Wookieepedia:WookieeProject_Pride "Wookieepedia:WookieeProject Pride") efforts to improve the wiki's coverage of LGBTQIA+ topics. Most external links on Wookieepedia now have [backup archival links](/wiki/Forum:SH:Pages_with_missing_archive_links "Forum:SH:Pages with missing archive links") to keep a better record of the ever-changing Internet, and [bot](/wiki/Wookieepedia:Bots "Wookieepedia:Bots") systems have automated many monotonous site maintenance tasks such as page archivals for the [status article](/wiki/Wookieepedia:Featured_article_nominations "Wookieepedia:Featured article nominations") peer review system.

Our work continues unabated. Thousands more pages [need to be created](/wiki/Special:WantedPages "Special:WantedPages"), [lack citations](/wiki/Category:Articles_needing_citation "Category:Articles needing citation"), [await expansion](/wiki/Category:Articles_to_be_expanded "Category:Articles to be expanded"), and could use [more images](/wiki/Category:Articles_needing_illustration "Category:Articles needing illustration"). All the while, the franchise continues to grow and [require updates](/wiki/Category:Articles_in_need_of_updating "Category:Articles in need of updating"). As we enter our third decade, we would love for more readers to [**join our ranks!**](/wiki/Wookieepedia:Welcome,_newcomers "Wookieepedia:Welcome, newcomers") May the Force be with us in the next twenty years‚Ä¶ ‚ú®

 Article Showcase

  

[![Nishr Taskforce](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](/wiki/Nishr_Taskforce "Nishr Taskforce")

The **[Nishr Taskforce](/wiki/Nishr_Taskforce "Nishr Taskforce")** was a unit of [Alliance Special Forces](/wiki/Alliance_Special_Forces/Legends "Alliance Special Forces/Legends") assembled in [0 ABY](/wiki/0_ABY/Legends "0 ABY/Legends") for the [Nishr Campaign](/wiki/Nishr_Campaign "Nishr Campaign"), a series of battles fought on the [planet](/wiki/Planet/Legends "Planet/Legends") [Nishr](/wiki/Nishr "Nishr") during the [Galactic Civil War](/wiki/Galactic_Civil_War/Legends "Galactic Civil War/Legends"). Consisting of three [platoons](/wiki/Platoon/Legends "Platoon/Legends") of [Wilderness Fighters](/wiki/Wilderness_Fighters "Wilderness Fighters") and a single platoon of [Pathfinders](/wiki/Pathfinders/Legends "Pathfinders/Legends"), the unit was commanded by [Major](/wiki/Major/Legends "Major/Legends") [Fisk Csino](/wiki/Fisk_Csino "Fisk Csino") and styled as a light-armor company, employing numerous ground vehicles to keep the company on the move. Created in response to the forceful [suppression](/wiki/Nishr_Suppression "Nishr Suppression") of the native [Nish](/wiki/Nish "Nish") by [Imperial](/wiki/Galactic_Empire/Legends "Galactic Empire/Legends") forces on Nishr, the Nishr Taskforce was assigned to harass the local [garrison](/wiki/Garrison/Legends "Garrison/Legends") and encourage the local population to stage a guerrilla-style rebellion. Operating out of several hidden bases, the company‚Äîin concert with local forces from the [Nishr Resistance](/wiki/Nishr_Resistance "Nishr Resistance")‚Äîeliminated the [Imperial garrison's](/wiki/Nishr_Imperial_garrison "Nishr Imperial garrison") mobile elements. This forced the Imperials to heavily defend their command base and effectively concede control of the countryside and plains to the Rebel force. As the campaign carried on, Major Csino's request for a unit of [Infiltrator commandos](/wiki/Infiltrators/Legends "Infiltrators/Legends") to directly assault the garrison's command center was denied. Instead, the Alliance initiated [Operation Shadowplay](/wiki/Operation_Shadowplay "Operation Shadowplay"), designed to fool the Imperial planetary commander, [Governor](/wiki/Governor/Legends "Governor/Legends")-[General](/wiki/General/Legends "General/Legends") [Vin Kollis](/wiki/Vin_Kollis "Vin Kollis"), into thinking that the unit had been reinforced with Infiltrators, when in reality they had not been. **([Read more‚Ä¶](/wiki/Nishr_Taskforce "Nishr Taskforce"))**

 Community Projects

  

*Below are some of the current community projects happening around Wookieepedia. If you are interested in joining in, check out our [newcomers hub page](/wiki/Wookieepedia:Welcome,_newcomers "Wookieepedia:Welcome, newcomers") to start your editing journey!*

* [**Project Stardust**](/wiki/Wookieepedia:Project_Stardust "Wookieepedia:Project Stardust") is improving the [canon](/wiki/Canon "Canon") article for [Cloud City](/wiki/Cloud_City "Cloud City") and the [Legends](/wiki/Star_Wars_Legends "Star Wars Legends") article for [Echo Base](/wiki/Echo_Base/Legends "Echo Base/Legends"). Visit the [canon](/wiki/Wookieepedia:Project_Stardust:_Cloud_City "Wookieepedia:Project Stardust: Cloud City") and [Legends](/wiki/Wookieepedia:Project_Stardust:_Echo_Base/Legends "Wookieepedia:Project Stardust: Echo Base/Legends") project pages to join the effort!
* The [**Featured article**](/wiki/Wookieepedia:Featured_article_nominations "Wookieepedia:Featured article nominations"), [**Good article**](/wiki/Wookieepedia:Good_article_nominations "Wookieepedia:Good article nominations"), and [**Comprehensive article**](/wiki/Wookieepedia:Comprehensive_article_nominations "Wookieepedia:Comprehensive article nominations") nomination processes help bring articles up to the highest possible standards. Join the effort by helping review nominations.
* [**WookieeProject Creators**](/wiki/Wookieepedia:WookieeProject_Creators "Wookieepedia:WookieeProject Creators") is adding the full credits to all media articles. You can assist the team by visiting any article on a piece of media and expanding the credits list.
* [**WookieeProject Pride**](/wiki/Wookieepedia:WookieeProject_Pride "Wookieepedia:WookieeProject Pride") is providing citations for pronouns and gender for [in-universe](/wiki/In-universe "In-universe") topics. See the [Sourcing policy](/wiki/Wookieepedia:Sourcing "Wookieepedia:Sourcing") for rules on how to cite pronouns and gender.

[[Source]](https://starwars.fandom.com/wiki/Template:Book)

:   "*I've been waiting for you, Obi-Wan. We meet again at last. The circle is now complete. When I left you, I was but the learner. Now, I am the master.*"  
    "*Only a master of evil, Darth.*"
:   ‚ÄïDarth Vader and Obi-Wan Kenobi in *A New Hope*[[4]](#cite_note-Episode_IV-4)

***Master of Evil*** is a *[Star Wars](/wiki/Star_Wars "Star Wars")* hardcover [canon](/wiki/Canon "Canon") novel that was written by [Adam Christopher](/wiki/Adam_Christopher "Adam Christopher") and published by [Random House Worlds](/wiki/Random_House_Worlds "Random House Worlds") on [November 11](/wiki/November_11 "November 11"), [2025](/wiki/2025 "2025") alongside an [audiobook version](/wiki/Master_of_Evil_(audiobook) "Master of Evil (audiobook)").[[2]](#cite_note-RH-2) Prior to its title reveal, it was codenamed "Nauset Lighthouse" on Random House's website.[[5]](#cite_note-Lighthouse-5) The book was first teased as "*Master of Evil*" via a listing on Random House Worlds' website[[2]](#cite_note-RH-2) before receiving a formal reveal on [April 10](/wiki/April_10 "April 10"), 2025, via [StarWars.com](/wiki/StarWars.com "StarWars.com") ahead of [Celebration 2025](/wiki/Celebration_Japan_(2025) "Celebration Japan (2025)").[[1]](#cite_note-Reveal-1)

The novel is focused upon the dark journey of the [Sith Lord](/wiki/Dark_Lord_of_the_Sith "Dark Lord of the Sith") [Darth Vader](/wiki/Anakin_Skywalker "Anakin Skywalker") in the time between [*Star Wars* Episode III *Revenge of the Sith*](/wiki/Star_Wars:_Episode_III_Revenge_of_the_Sith "Star Wars: Episode III Revenge of the Sith") and [*Star Wars* Episode IV *A New Hope*](/wiki/Star_Wars:_Episode_IV_A_New_Hope "Star Wars: Episode IV A New Hope"). The story features Vader on the haunting quest to overcome [death](/wiki/Death "Death") itself,[[1]](#cite_note-Reveal-1) a power first promised to him by his [Sith Master](/wiki/Sith_Master "Sith Master") [Darth Sidious](/wiki/Darth_Sidious "Darth Sidious") when he first fell to the [dark side of the Force](/wiki/Dark_side_of_the_Force "Dark side of the Force").[[6]](#cite_note-Episode_III-6) The book is notable for being the first Vader-focused novel in ten years after [2015](/wiki/2015 "2015") saw the release of *[Lords of the Sith](/wiki/Lords_of_the_Sith "Lords of the Sith")*.[[7]](#cite_note-Free_Books_Hoeler-7) Christopher described the novel as "a journey to the dark side"[[8]](#cite_note-JourneytotheDark-8) and a big deal for him personally.[[9]](#cite_note-BigBook-9) The novel's title has its roots in *A New Hope*, within which [Jedi Master](/wiki/Jedi_Master "Jedi Master") [Obi-Wan Kenobi](/wiki/Obi-Wan_Kenobi "Obi-Wan Kenobi") rebuke's Vader's claim of having become a "master" by decrying him as having only become "a master of evil."[[4]](#cite_note-Episode_IV-4) *Master of Evil* will connect with [Charles Soule](/wiki/Charles_Soule "Charles Soule")'s series [*Star Wars: Darth Vader* (2017)](/wiki/Star_Wars:_Darth_Vader_(2017) "Star Wars: Darth Vader (2017)"), and will fill in a gap in one of the series' timeline jumps."[[10]](#cite_note-Celebration_2025-10)

## Publisher's summary[]

***After* Revenge of the Sith*, a newly forged Darth Vader hunts for the secrets of life and death under the watchful eye of Emperor Palpatine.***

*In the wake of Emperor Palpatine's rise to power, the true nature of his most sinister enforcer remains a mystery. Darth Vader is a dominant yet illusive figure: the shadow cast by a malignant Imperial regime, unknowable to even its top officials. But even as his humanity gives way to myth, Vader remains haunted by the promises of the dark side, seeking the ultimate power that his master has hinted at but withheld‚Äîthe power to conquer death itself.*

*On the volcanic world of Mustafar, Vader undertakes a dark ritual, bleeding a kyber crystal to forge his lightsaber. This act unleashes a power far greater than he anticipated, giving him a glimpse into the limitless potential of the Force.*

*Vader is determined to follow this vision, even if it means defying his master's orders. Yet he finds the Emperor suspiciously supportive of his mission, even sending Vader to the Diso system to investigate rumors of a Force-wielding shaman able to raise the dead. At his side are a cadre of the Emperor's scarlet-robed Royal Guard, led by Colonel Halland Goth‚Äîa decorated soldier with a very personal interest in Vader‚Äôs mission.*

*Even as the Emperor's true motivations reveal themselves, Vader falls deeper into obsession. His journey takes him far across the galaxy, chasing rumors and phantoms. But no matter how far he travels, he cannot escape the shadows within his own soul. Haunted by the echoes of his past, Vader circles the true resolution to his quest: only once all weakness is purged can he become a master of evil.*

## Continuity[]

* In the prologue, [Count](/wiki/Count "Count") [Dooku](/wiki/Dooku "Dooku") reflects that, as he understands the [Sith](/wiki/Sith "Sith") [Grand Plan](/wiki/Grand_Plan "Grand Plan"), the [Confederacy of Independent Systems](/wiki/Confederacy_of_Independent_Systems "Confederacy of Independent Systems") is to win the [Clone Wars](/wiki/Clone_Wars "Clone Wars") so as to usher in the reign of the Sith under Darth Sidious and himself.[[11]](#cite_note-Master_of_Evil-11) However, most other stories and sources suggest[[12]](#cite_note-CVD-12)[[13]](#cite_note-Trkn-13)[[14]](#cite_note-RiseFall-14)[[15]](#cite_note-HC15DB-15) or confirm that Dooku knew the Sith plan was for the CIS to lose the [Clone Wars](/wiki/Clone_Wars "Clone Wars") while the [Galactic Republic](/wiki/Galactic_Republic "Galactic Republic") is transformed into their empire.[[16]](#cite_note-CH-16)[[17]](#cite_note-BC61-17)
